boardgame.name: Zodiac
Zodiac Adventure
boardgame.description: Zodiac, or Zodiac Adventure, is a text adventure by Geoff M. Phillips. The goal is to find six treasures.

boardgame.name: Terror by the Lake
boardgame.description:
It’s going to be a great weekend. A group of 5 friends are going to spend a fun weekend at the lake. Little do they know but there is a 6th guest that will be dropping by...

You are an undead killer that happens to come across 5 teenagers at an isolated lake house, you must kill all of them before time runs out.

There are 8 different killers to chose from, each with different abilities. Some killers are harder to play than others. The killer can never die but the game ends when time runs out.

Terror by the Lake is a thematic horror game that is designed to be a light game that you can play in a short period of time. With only a few components you can play almost anywhere.

boardgame.name: MUD
boardgame.description:
You are a wealthy mogul trying to influence the next presidential election for your own gain. Win by being the first to secure a solid block of voters of either party. You decide how corrupt to be.

Every player is dealt seven cards and can place three voter cards face up in front of them (creating a voter map) each turn. Depending on how many players, you'll need at least three voters in three regions, all of the same political affiliation, on your map to win (undecided voters are wild).

Peppered in the deck are RAT cards, which give you strong advantages. However, every time you play a RAT card, you must also draw a Scandal card, which contains a punishment. This punishment is not enacted immediately — rather, it sits face down in front of you until someone plays a DIG card on you. The DIG card will force you to turn over a scandal and abide by the punishment. Do you risk a scandal, or do you play it safe? The choice is yours in this dirty game of American elections.

-description from designer
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 31- An Interview With Pillbox Games

boardgame.name: ThingMaker
boardgame.description:
designer summary

ThingMaker lets you create and store a collection of items, devices, or equipment using the design sequence found in the Traveller5 Core Rules.

The app includes a list of things which are saved and restored automatically. Things may have multiple variants, and an optional protective case for each variant.

Thing descriptions may be exported in text format.

Compatible with iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Ireland Edition
boardgame.description:
"Cead Mille Failte" to the Republic of Ireland edition of the great property board game Monopoly.
Ireland is famous for its writers and poets such as James Joyce, Sean OiCasey, W.B. Yeats, and Seamus Heaney and its musicians, which include U2, Thin Lizzy and Boyzone.
Sports such as horse racing, Grey hound racing and golf thrive, while Hurling, recognised as one of the fastest games in the world, and Gaelic Football are the national sports.
Home of the shamrock, the Aran jumper, the "craic agus ceol" (fun and music) Ireland maintains its reputation of the "Land of the Welcomes".

—description from the back of the box

boardgame.name: Evolsters & Friends
boardgame.description: You are an evolster handler. Your mission is to explore the Kōya region, catch wild evolsters, win in evolster arenas, and defend evolsters against poachers. Your teacher Professor Pine has been overcome by pumblebee stings, leaving you to fend for yourselves while she rests in the hospital.

boardgame.name: Xeno-Force: Rulebook
boardgame.description:
Xeno-Force pits mankind’s finest marines against alien threats in a scenario driven fast play skirmish game.
Battle your way past tough alien horrors to complete your mission.
Play games in your favourite sci-fi universe with this flexible and detailed system.
Xeno-Force is a scenario driven game. It is about using your games to tell interesting stories and building those stories.

This unique semi-cooperative game means you and your friends work together in a team against a single alien opponent to accomplish your objectives, but also compete to gain the most glory and honour.

Jump straight into the action with pre-generated characters and scenarios, or play as a longer campaign game, linking missions together to develop your own engaging story.

Xeno-Force rulebook includes:


Detailed but straight forward game rules with lots of examples
Three introductory scenarios with more on the website
Full campaign and character development and advancement rules
Six difference character classes with unique combat styles
Tons of weapons, equipment and abilities
Nine Xenotypes ( “Bugs” and “Cyborgs” etc.); pick one that suits your model collection
Rules for vehicles


Full Advancement Rules:

Xeno-Force allows you to advance your characters from mission to mission using a very thorough and detailed advancement system. Watch your characters grow in strength and develop through campaigns. Specialise them in different styles of combat so each one can become genuinely unique.


Use for RPGs:

Xeno-Force works really well to support RPG games to run tactical missions when the players "call in the cavalry"


Full Support:

The game is fully supported online, with missions and aliens published on the website.


Community:

Please join in the community and share your experiences, questions and scenarios. The more players who join in the better.


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Marvel Battleworld: Series 1 Thanos Ship Showdown
boardgame.description:
Pick your favorite Hero, rescue your friends, and win battles to defeat Thanos! Expanding the core game established with the Marvel Battleworld Battle Ball and Mega Packs, the Thanos Ship Showdown brings an exclusive Thanos character and his brutal flagship into the fight! Stop Thanos as he tries to distract and defeat your Heroes!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Flucht aus dem Alltag
boardgame.description:
Driving to work, ironing, cooking - who does not know the feeling that everyday life is really absorbed and captured. In this unique escape game that is actually the case!

The exciting story takes the fellow players on a mysterious adventure full of tricky puzzles and encrypted codes. Only those who manage to solve all the tasks in the given time will ultimately be able to escape everyday life. But be careful: If you don't want to be misled here, you need ingenuity, creativity and the ability to work in a team.

The ultimate game for all puzzle lovers and escape fans.

boardgame.name: Flucht aus der Schule
boardgame.description:
It is the last day of school before the holidays. After a long nap in history class, you are shocked to find that you are suddenly sitting alone in the classroom - and all the doors to the outside are locked!

Why didn't anyone wake you up? And how do you escape on vacation now? You have to find out in this exciting escape game. Now you and your fellow players have to show talent for combination, creativity and team spirit in order to solve the encrypted messages and tricky puzzles in this game. And against time!
So get started right away! Who wants to spend their vacation at school?

boardgame.name: Locked Adventures: Der magische Fall II
boardgame.description:
After you have solved the riddle of the mysterious magical sleep, it quickly becomes clear to you: You now have to find Albert. But what is really hidden behind the call for help
Potions Master? Follow his magical trail and you will become London from one
get to know a completely new perspective. But hurry because you are not them
The only ones who are on Albert's heels. The time is running!

boardgame.name: Entkommen!: Die geheime Bibliothek
boardgame.description:
Locked up in the secret library.
A series of puzzles.
A locked door without a key.
60 minutes.
Can you "ESCAPE"?

boardgame.name: Call of Madness
boardgame.description:
In this tower defense game you play as the priests of the Cthulhu cults who are trying to summon this Great Ancient One. However, it will not be so simple, because apart from the investigators themselves, you are also disturbed by other cults that strive for the same as you.

Players sacrifice their cultists to gain the powers of the Ancient Ones, and to obtain their blessing. Each investigator is possessed by madness that strengthens his abilities. By defeating an investigator, players gain its essence, which in turn allows them to strengthen their actions.

Fight, sacrifice cultists and destroy enemies, so that you have the honor of summoning the most famous god of works of Lovecraft, H. P. Lovecraft.

—description from the designer

Catchup & Mousetard: ¡Batalla de Bocatas!
boardgame.description:
A family game about cooking, with "anisauces" as main characters (cats and mices fussioned with sauceboat) and funny faced ingredients to create sandwiches.

It's a roll & write game with a board and some character sheets.

Rolling a dice you advance the squares and collect the ingredients. You have to complete sandwiches and salads with these ingredients you're collecting. The first character to cook the 5 proposed sandwiches faster than the others will became the winner.

boardgame.name: Why You Lying!: Duel
boardgame.description:
Why You Lying! is a party game based on the classic Liar's Dice gameplay with some hilarious twists: legs and wings!

In this game, each player has a deck of 30 Animal cards consisting of 5 each of Cricket, Spider, Fish, Chicken, Rabbit, and the almighty Mascot Worker!
Players shuffle their deck and draw 5 hand cards at the beginning of each round. The start player will announce whether they will play with legs or wings in the current round by saying "I bet there are X (number of) Y (animals) with Z (amount of) legs (or wings) among all animals in all players' hand cards."
And players take turns to raise the bet by increasing X, Y (animals' hierarchy), or Z, OR they can call the previous player BLUFF!

Play smart with the information in your hand, and play cunning when you raise the bet. But beware, don't let the Mascot Workers fool you!

Why You Lying! Duel is a small box with 2 decks of cards for 2 players to enjoy. You can also combine it with the base game to have a epic 5-6 players bluffing war!

listing.notes: Played but very good condition.

boardgame.name: Armada: The Game of Epic Naval Warfare Rulebook
boardgame.description:
Armada is a tabletop game for two or more players. Choose your side and then command a fleet of Mantic miniatures to represent powerful navies such as the stoic and pious Basileans, or plot carnage and destruction with the rampaging orcs. With a range of beautiful ship models to choose from and many stories to tell, Armada is truly an amazing spectacle to play and witness.

The 96-page rulebook contains the core rules, 10 action-packed scenarios, and advanced rules for potentially devastating weather effects.

The rulebook is also contained in the Armada: Two Player Starter Set

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: CyberStrategy
boardgame.description:
CyberStrategy is an asymmetric, educational strategy board game in which 2 teams face each other: (1) a Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) tries to protect the bank's corporate network and its assets with security measures and (2) one or more hackers attack it trying to reveal the master password.

The CISO wins when he successfully fends off the attacks and reveals the identity of the hackers (all hackers lost all 3 identity tokens) or the hackers run out of bitcoin to fund their operation. In the other case, the hacker with the highest individual score (bitcoin) wins; which creates some healthy paranoia amongst the hackers.

The CISO starts with (at least) one defence card ("security measure") per type of attack and a starting budget in euro. Each hacker starts with 3 attacks of their choice, 3 identity tokens, and a starting money stack in bitcoin.

Each player also has a hidden goal for the game, which - when completed - gives them a leg up.

The game plays in 3 phases per round:

(1) the EVENT phase:
(a) the CISO receives his budgets (which depends on the number of hackers) and
(b) both CISO and hackers draw an event card (which is resolved as indicated on the card)

(2) the PLANNING phase:
(a) the CISO can spend budget to purchase additional security measures (= draw cards) and can deploy security measures (= ready cards)
(b) the hackers can learn additional attacks (= draw cards, up to a hand limit of 4) and can plan attacks
(3) the ATTACK phase:
(a) the hackers declare (joint or separate) attacks on the assets of the bank, starting with the assets at the outer rim of the corporate infrastructure (ATM, router,...) and pay for the attack (in bitcoins)
(b) the CISO then checks if they security measures they put in play are sufficient to block the attack
=> if the attack succeeded (defence value is lower than total attack value), the asset is hacked and the hackers receive a bitcoin reward for the successful attack
=> if the attack failed, the hacker leading the attack hands over 1 identity token to the CISO

boardgame.name: Gempire: Zarmund's Demands
boardgame.description:
Gempire is the strategic hidden-action, city-building board game with different victory conditions virtually every time you play! King Zarmund is holding a grand competition to decide his new capital city! He'll make 3 random demands at the beginning of the game. The first architect to satisfy any 2 of these 3 demands wins the game!

However, do you want to know the best part about Gempire? You NEVER have to wait your turn! That's right! EVERY player uses their own secret planning dry-erase book to choose their actions every round, and the entire group reveals their choices simultaneously! Now you can get the most action out of the limited time you have with your gaming buddies!

Using your secret Gempire planning book and your unpredictable wit, build up your city's population, gold, culture, and science and try to meet King Zarmund's random Demands in ways that your friends never saw coming! Upgrade your city, renovate your palace, and discover technologies that give you a leg up on your undeveloped opponents. Most of all, let NONE of them predict what you are writing! Always try to stay one step ahead and be the one laughing manically when the books fly open!

The re-playability of this game doesn't just stop at the victory conditions though! Every game, there will be a different combination of 5 useful technologies the players can discover to boost themselves to the finish line! Also, the rewards received for upgrading your palace are different every game as well! You truly will need to adapt and fine-tune your strategy every time you play this game!

If you are looking for a unique and highly engaging strategy game, Gempire is the game you've always wanted. There are no random, unforeseeable events that destroy your strategy. There is no way for vengeful opponents to easily ruin all your hard work planning a strategy (except for having a better one of course!) There are no unbalanced characters or races. And dice results are available for EVERY player, meaning no more losing just because the dice won't fall your way! Every player has the exact same opportunities 100% of the time. This game is purely a battle of brains! It's up to you to outsmart your friends to victory!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Pendragon
boardgame.description:
AD 673. Camelot has fallen. The jealous Sir Mordred has broken the fellowship of the Round Table with hatred and lies. Now King Arthur faces his final battle. Who will keep the dream of Camelot alive?

Pendragon is a character-driven narrative strategy game from the creators of the multi-award-winning 80 DAYS and Heaven’s Vault. Rally the Knights of the Round Table to reach Arthur before he meets his fate. Some will make it to Camlann. Others will fall. Yet every turn will change history.

Will Sir Lancelot be reunited with Queen Guinevere? Will she spurn him, or embrace him? Will Sir Kay ever forgive Sir Gawaine for siding with Sir Mordred? Can Morgana le Fay be trusted? Where is Merlyn? Who lies buried in Mordred’s graveyard? Who is the archer in the woods? What has become of Excalibur?

Secrets will be uncovered. Hearts will be broken. People will die. But maybe, just maybe, King Arthur can be saved...

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Imagination's Toybox
boardgame.description:
Cinematic Universal Roleplaying System

From the introduction:

On a scale of 1 to 10, how well can your character do what they're trying to do?

That's the entire basis of the Imagination's Toybox system. It really doesn't get any simpler than that.

User summary:

Imagination's Toybox originally was developed as the support engine for Knights of Torque & Recoil - it later was adapted into a genre-agnostic, general gaming system.

boardgame.name: Toybox Lite
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

If there were such a thing as a perfect game design that could be all things to all people, surely someone would have discovered it by now. Just as people have differing tastes in music, film, reading material, food, and significant others, so goes it with roleplaying systems. So goes it with Imagination’s Toybox as well. I wrote this game to suit my own tastes, which favor character interactions and streamlined rules over volumes of crunchy, fiddly bits. Some of you will undoubtedly enjoy it immensely; others will find that it doesn’t suit your tastes. I’m okay with that.
...
What you’re reading right now is Toybox Lite, the system boiled down to its barest essence.

boardgame.name: Off Topic
boardgame.description:
Play this Quick-witted game with friends for a good laugh. Draw a card to set the topics, and roll the die to set the letter that your responses must begin with. As you race against time, your answers will get a little outrageous and a little OFF TOPIC!

—description from the back of the box

Players receive a personal whiteboard and whiteboard marker, and one player reveals a card with multiple prompts; one for each pair of lines on the whiteboard. Then the die is rolled to determine what letter every answer must start with. Once set, the timer is flipped and players must attempt to answer as many of the prompts as they can before time runs out.

After this phase, players will go through the prompts to see what everyone else wrote. Be careful, though, as if multiple people come up with the same answer, NO ONE gets points! For every unique answer to the prompt you have written down (up to two) you gain a point. Once the comparing and point-scoring is done, players erase their board and start a new round. After 5 rounds, the player with the most points is the winner.

—user summary

boardgame.name: One Small Step: Deluxe Edition
boardgame.description:
Lead the United States or Soviet Union Space Agency in this engine building, worker placement, race for the moon Eurogame.

Play on a team of one or two players where each player on a team controls either the Engineer Workers or the Administrator Workers for their team.

Coordinate your actions with your teammate on each of your turns to either place an Engineer or Administrator Worker on board actions to gather the games 9 different resources, draft development cards, increase your media coverage, recruit astronauts, upgrade resources, develop your space flight capability, or spend resources to launch humanity’s first unmanned and manned Missions into space.

Which type of Worker you place changes the effect that a board action has. Each board action can only be used once each round, so placing a Worker does not only prevent your opponents from using the action but prevents your teammate from using the action's alternative effect with their workers.

Gain the advantage in the media to place your worker first in a round or to gain a media bonus for special one time abilities and bonus resources.

Score Victory Points by building cards you drafted or by successfully launching Missions into space. Every successful launch you have upgrades one of the board actions not only for your team but also your opponents. Successfully launch enough Manned Missions to achieve the first manned moon landing before your rivals, gaining you bonus Victory Points and ending the game. The team who has the most Victory Points at the end contributed the most to one of humanities greatest achievements and wins the game.

One Small Step provides a fun learning experience about the space race that makes it perfect for a US history curriculum in the classroom and home school.

—description from the publisher


Deluxe edition also contains the Hidden Heroes and Mission Control expansions, along with additional miniatures.

boardgame.name: Lego Ninjago Shadow of Ronin
boardgame.description: LEGO Ninjago: Shadow of Ronin is the third Ninjago video game released on Nintendo 3DS and PlayStation Vita. It was later released as an app for IOS and Android. The events of its story take place between the fourth and fifth seasons, though it is non-canon.[1] Ronin served as the main antagonist, while the Dark Samurai are the villainous faction of this game.

boardgame.name: Imagine: Fashion Life
boardgame.description:
Experience three fabulous fashion careers: become the trendy designer, the most glamorous top model or the best mall owner!
This 3D game features high-quality, realistic graphics and allows players with a love of fashion to truly unleash their creativity and live their dream career.

Live the life of a fashionista!

-Fashion designer: Create original outfits & ultimately your own brand, as well as organize fashion shows

-Top model: Pose for glamorous photo shoots and set the catwalks on fire with your perfect runway walk

-Mall owner: Open and arrange stores, decorate the mall, promote the trendiest cosmetics and fashion brands in stores, and manage your budget to create a world-class mall! Even open new stores abroad!

Keep up with the latest trends:

-Choose from all the latest 2011 and 2012 fashions

-Get new missions depending on your profile and other player’s profiles that you pass via StreetPass. For example, a top model player could be asked to wear a fashion designer player’s brand for a fashion show

Be a social butterfly and stay connected with friends: manage your contacts list with your PDA and keep in touch with them to be successful!

Download a new non-player character Jane Lorner, with 6 exciting missions, a rock background and Folk Festival clothes! Players will also get:

Winter clothes to enhance the wardrobe
Sets of items for your apartment
A new haircut and
New music for the catwalk mini-game!
In-game content available for purchase using stored account funds.

boardgame.name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Danger of the Ooze
boardgame.description: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Danger of the Ooze is a 2.5D platform video game developed by WayForward Technologies and published by Activision. It is the second video game based on the 2012 Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles TV series and features elements from the show's second and third seasons.[1] It was released as a sequel to the 2013 game Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles. The game also features gameplay elements and homages to the 1989 Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles NES game. The digital versions of the game, alongside other Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles games published by Activision, were pulled from all digital storefronts in January 2017 when the rights expired and they chose not to renew the license.

boardgame.name: ESPN Baseball
boardgame.description: ESPN Major League Baseball (ESPN MLB) is a baseball game in 2004 for Xbox and PS2. It is MLB instead of World Series Baseball. It is published by Sega.

boardgame.name: Counting Coup and Cutting Horses
boardgame.description:
A set of rules for wargaming in the Old West from 1700 to 1890 A.D.. Mechanics are fun, easy and innovative. Suitable for solo, cooperative, or head to head play.

The focus is on inter tribal wars especially those of the Plains Indians. But mountain men, rangers, cowboys, the regular U.S. army, Navahos, Apaches, and immigrant woodland and southeastern tribes are also covered.

The game is played with miniature figures of any scale. A unique feature is the use of playing cards in place of dice to resolve game mechanics. Players draw cards from a standard card deck, which is reshuffled periodically. Cards determine activation, movement distances, the outcome of shooting or melee combat, and of pin and morale tests. There are extensive notes on specific native American tribes and a system to play solo.

boardgame.name: Second World War at Sea: Plan Z – Stolen Fleets
boardgame.description:
The German Navy captured many enemy vessels, but placed none in service larger than a destroyer. In Plan Z: Stolen Fleets, the German Kriegsmarine adds battleships, aircraft carriers, cruisers and more taken from the French, Soviet and Dutch navies to its order of battle along with a few new German-built ships.

Stolen Fleets is an expansion for our Second World War at Sea: Plan Z, itself an expansion set based on the notorious but never-completed German Plan Z fleet expansion program. There are 80 new die cut, silky smooth playing pieces (60 doubled-sized ship pieces and 20 standard ones) and 30 additional scenarios extending the story of Plan Z.

Ships now steaming under German colors include the French battleship Richelieu, battle cruiser Strasbourg and aircraft carrier Joffre; the Soviet battleship Sovetsky Soyuz, battle cruiser Kronshtadt and heavy cruiser Kirov, and the Dutch cruiser Eendracht. And lots more. The Germans also add the H41-type super-battleships to their fleet and two more liners converted to aircraft carriers.

Requires Plan Z, Bismarck and Arctic Convoy to enjoy all of the scenarios.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Bad Attitudes
boardgame.description:
The Action Movie Roleplaying Game

Publisher's blurb:

A lighthearted game paying homage to the best and worst of 1980s-style action cop films, their formulaic plots, and their generally over-the-top cinematic silliness. Great for a pick-up game or filler between regular campaign sessions. Easy to learn, easy to play, usable for one-shots or short campaigns.

boardgame.name: League of Misfits
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Leaping across buildings, chasing the robot minions of a mad scientist, clouding people’s minds and seeking the secrets of an arcane society, or perhaps rappelling down from a waiting air ship, seeking to thwart the machinations of an alien invader—you are an adventurer in a world full of dangers and excitement.

You are part of the League of Misfits.

League of Misfits is a game of pulp adventure, focused on creating memorable characters and directing them through exciting stories. The mechanical system is based on dice provided by the character’s personal attributes rolled against a static target number.

This game is written by the creator of Sword’s Edge, Nefertiti Overdrive, and Centurion: Legionaries of Rome. If you are looking for something new that is easy to learn, easy to play, and allows strong character customization, this could be the game for you.

boardgame.name: Darkness Inc
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A fantasy cyberpunk RPG set in an otherworldly City where characters show up with no memory of how they got there.

Characters have been transformed into psychics, ogres, or breeds (roughly analogous to class). The character Type controls access to certain powers and abilities.

Darkness Inc uses a simple dice-pool system. Characters have four attributes with 8d6 or 10d6 (GM decision) distributed into them. Characters also select 3 Skills (from a list of 32 Skills).

boardgame.name: Death in the Trenches: The Great War 1914-1918 (Second Edition)
boardgame.description:
"DEATH IN THE TRENCHES" is a strategic-level World War I wargame covering the entire war, from the opening shots in Serbia and Belgium to the final defeat -- or victory! -- of Germany and Austria-Hungary in 1918. The game includes a map illustrated by Jonathan Carnehl, stretching from the Pyrenees to Moscow, and from Norway to the Sudan, covering every square inch of territory in Europe and the Near East which saw combat from 1914 to 1918, in a manageable 34x22" format. An additional map shows the German colonies

The game also features 520 beautifully-illustrated counters depicting the national armies that fought in the war -- from the Germans, French, British and Russians all the way down to the Persians, Montenegrins, Armenians, South Africans, and a host of other specialized units (French Foreign Legion, Gurkhas, Italian "Arditi", Cossacks, Tyrolean Kaiserjaeger, Zionists, Bavarians, "Dunsterforce"... even the Chinese may send a small expeditionary force).

DEATH IN THE TRENCHES includes a 28-page rulebook (and an additional 20 pages of setups and random events) detailing the game's unique combat system (no CRT!) which portrays the grinding nature of World War I combat in a realistic way that still gives players plenty of options to pursue. Using army-level units (which contain numbers of divisional level formations, represented off-map), players use numerous special military abilities to drive back the enemy.

Detailed random events rules give you more gory details about World War I than you've ever seen before in a game, while helping keep play simple and straightforward. Lenin, the Senussi revolt, intrigue in the Romanian court, the Cruise of the Emden, the Armenian Massacre, the Sinai Pipeline, the Ukrainian Reactionary Hetmanate, Rasputin, Mata Hari, the Russian shell shortage, the murder of Edith Cavell, Wilhelm Wassmuss (the "German Lawrence"), Lawrence of Arabia, the Nestorian resistance, Pancho Villa, the Grand Duke Nicholas, Thomas Masaryk, the Red Baron, Czech Legion, Irish Rising, Berber Revolt, air raids, typhus, influenza... they're all here.

For the World War I buff, "DITT" has everything: Tanks, Alpenkorps, artillery barrages, flamethrowers, poison gas, Krupp guns, Mustapha Kemal, the Royal Air Force, French elan... while the great wartime leaders all leave their mark (good or bad!) on history: Bruchmuller, Haig, Hoffmann, Mackensen, Hindenburg and Ludendorff, Rennenkampf and Samsonov, Sarrail, Von Francois, Foch, Brusilov, Nivelle, Plehve, Putnik, Yudenich... history is overflowing. Players command the armed forces of nearly forty nations, in a game that still manages to be small enough to fit on your table!

It sounds like a massive game, but it isn't. DEATH IN THE TRENCHES is designed to be played--easy to play, hard to master. You'll learn things about World War I you never knew before, and you'll have to face the same crises the leaders of the Entente and Central Powers did. Think you can do better than Douglas Haig and Robert Nivelle? Now it's your turn.

The original edition of Death in the Trenches won the Charles S. Roberts awards for Best DTP-Produced Boardgame (Charles S. Roberts Awards) for 2005.

The 2021 edition takes this WW1 classic to new heights, and features a revised and expanded combat system that preserves the charm of the original but is much more faithful to actual WWI battle numbers and provides much more detail on individual countries' distinctive military strengths and weaknesses. Each individual battle now takes place on an off-map display that simulates a real WWI battle, each battle opening with a "spearhead" force that drives into a "target area". The system of entrenchment remains simple and easy to play, but takes into account the role of time and manpower in creating different levels of trench effectiveness.

Added detail includes the Hindenburg Line, German siege guns, and the possible flight of the French government. Instability in the Balkans, and the allegiance of the Roumanian and Bulgarian governments, may lead to unexpected political reversals in Europe's turbulent "backyard". The impact of the Russian Revolution is expanded, with several possible directions for Russia to travel including the rise of a better Czar, or even the takeover of Soviet Russia by Trotsky, which could bring Russia back into the war!

The system of military reinforcements has been transformed, with greater reliance on historical unit production and manpower. Great Power support and sponsorship for minor country forces has been made a vital part of the game, and the "major minors" like Serbia, Romania and Bulgaria now have their own Army Reserves which give each country a more distinctive role.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Broken Skies
boardgame.description:
Broken Skies is a game for two or more players. A standard game will generally consist of 2-3 models per side. Players first choose the faction they want to play and select a force up to the agreed points value.

When selecting your force, you start with selecting your aircraft. These may then be upgraded by adding pilot skills or aircraft upgrades. A player may choose a maximum of one Pilot Skill upgrade and one Aircraft upgrade for each model.

Broken Skies is all about fun customisation of your list to make it uniquely yours! Of course, you don’t have to customise with skills and upgrades. You can just take the basic model as listed on the stat card. These represent the basic rookie pilots that has yet to win glory in the skies.

With this in mind it’s also possible to play a series of friendly games in which your force builds their skills and upgrades over the course of the campaign.

boardgame.name: Everyone is John: A Curiously Unusual Roleplaying Game
boardgame.description:
Back of the Book:

You are John.

But you are not the only one...

Welcome to Everyone is John, the curiously unusual role playing game where each player struggles with their own unique skin=lol sets and personal obsessions.

The catch?

Every player is a Voice in one man’s head.

Everyone is John is a fast and fun competitive roleplaying game where each player assumes the identify of a “Voice” inside the head of John - an insane man with no real identity of his own. John’s actions, skills, knowledge, and goals change constantly as the Voices vie for control of him by using their own finite Willpower.

The confused adventures of John will follow the will of the Voices, with each Voice struggling to achieve their own obsessive goals before all Willpower is gone and the game is over - with only one Voice left as the victor.

This new edition of the cult-classic RPG introduces enhanced rules, gameplay examples, and numerous adventure seeds to entice players and game masters.

boardgame.description:
3 promotional cards shrink wrapped in 1565, St. Elmo's Pay: The Great Siege of Malta Card Game.

boardgame.name: Trepidation: Horror card game
boardgame.description:
Trepidation is a cooperative horror survival game, where players are trying trying to make it to the end of the forest. All players are given a role card at the beginning of the game, which is broken down by the townspeople and the possessed role. Townspeople are trying to make it to the end of the forest, while the possessed player is trying to have everyone killed before they reach the end.

There are monsters and events standing in between you and your escape. Your survival will depend upon collecting and trading items, strategizing, and figuring out whom to trust in your party. Can you make it out of the forest alive?

Every player is dealt a limited number of location and item cards. The location cards are used throughout the game to progress through the forest. Each location card will indicate whether you will draw an item, event, or monster card for that turn.

There are unique location cards found within the deck called landmarks. The landmarks are what you will be searching for and must complete as a group to continue your progress through the forest. Depending on the difficulty you select at the beginning of the game, you will have to complete either 3, 5 or 7 landmarks to make it out of the forest. Planning ahead is a necessity, as the landmarks will force the entire party to combat monsters the moment they are played.

Every monster has a unique way that it must be warded off. Some monsters are more problematic, and even more perilous to come across than others. Use your items and plan ahead in order to overcome that which awaits you and your team.

Be careful, though, as the possessed player may try to deceive you. They can use the event, item and landmark cards to their advantage, and will try blending in as a normal towns person throughout the game... waiting until your guard is down before sabotaging you.

boardgame.name: Shattered Tower
boardgame.description:
From website:

The Setting:
Tyntyr is a vast and extremely hostile world that has risen from the ashes of a war between the world itself and an ancient and advanced civilization, fallen into ruin, shattered and partially forgotten.

Players will travel through an environment heavily dominated by nature, ruled by the Dra-Idjias, mystical and powerful creatures that imprisoned, and now control and govern the offspring of that ancient colonizers that survived the war centuries ago and still lives on the planet.

Players will be part of the Vanguard, a guild composed by the few people of their respective races able to bypass the tight control of the world’s sentinels and visiting the world outside, with the purpose of discovering what once was.. and what still can be…

The player's job is to incarnate explorers and adventurers, to get in the shoes of pioneersfinding a home in the Vanguard, willing to risk their lives, far from civilization, fighting to death just to earn the respect of the companions and to bring knowledge to mankind.

The System:
Shattered Tower works on the peculiar D6System we created.

How does it work - we've got a classic but versatile list of skills (which also includes COMBAT as an ability, for example) and we put it together with the kind of mechanics that you can nowadays find in modern narrative RPGs, creating a unique system which feels very functional to the setting.

Long story short, every character's got his skills set with ability scores (from 1 to 6) determined by the construction of the player character (PC) build.

Those points define the number of dices the player's gotta roll when trying an ability check. success is gained when dices give only 5 or 6.

The few basics of this system also include that the difficulty coefficient of the test that is faced - when higher than the score of the PC - determines the deprivation of X dice to pull, where X stands for each point by which the difficulty exceeds the score of the PC.

boardgame.name: Tavern Tales: Legends of Dungeon Drop
boardgame.description:
Following your perilous drop into the dungeon, you are called home to the Traveler's Tavern for some warm Gingerbrew and an evening of heroic tales shared with the local rabble. Complete your Dungeon Drop story with Tavern Tales, as you and your companions compare mighty deeds in a strategic game of boasting and one-upmanship!

In this raucous card game of set collection and subtle bluffing, 2 to 5 heroes scheme their way to becoming the most renowned hero of epic legends!

--

Tavern Tales plays over a variable number of rounds. In each round, player take turns as follows:

STEP 1: Using your hand of hero cards, stake your claim. Select one of the locations in play and identify which treasures you claim to have found or how many monsters you slayed there.

STEP 2: Dispute your companions. Other players may now use their hand of hero cards to dispute your claim and attempt to take the glory for themselves.

STEP 3: Turn your stories into legends. After a bit of one-upping and strategic bluffing, a final victor for the claim is declared. That player collects the disputed treasure or monster cards and score points based on how many of those identical cards they have previously collected. Through this set collection aspect, players are incentivized to remain in the lead on one or several types of claims in order to prevail.

The game ends when one player has achieved enough fame to become the most renowned hero of epic legends!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Message in a Bottle
boardgame.description: Four bottles with messages are underway. On their trip they have to survive several whirlpools. You have to pay attention, if you want to know what has made it to the end!

boardgame.name: Unity: Veteran Infantry of Unified Space – For Renegade Scout 2nd edition
boardgame.description:
Unity: Veteran Infantry of Unified Space is the first supplement for Renegade Scout 2nd edition introduces Veteran troops to your games.

This adds a new squad type for use in the Army Builder, along with notes on how they are incorporated into the normal section structure of your army. Veteran squads have a diverse array of weapons and access to additional abilities, making them perfect for that special, cool squad of miniatures you have or for kit-bashing a grim-faced squad of survivors.

The supplement also adds the option to add a veteran squad leader to most existing squads of infantry, adding a bit of personal touch as the wise old "Sarge" leads the fresh recruits into battle.

Finally, expanded background material helps put the new rules in context within the Unified Space setting.

The ..of Unified Space series is intending to be a series of small, bite-sized expansions for Renegade Scout 2nd edition, adding new content and options to the game system, expanding the universe and generally increasing the amount of fun to be had.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Renegade Scout 2: Bleeding Edge Retro Gaming

boardgame.name: Lottori
boardgame.description:
By a lake, in the garden, by the sea or in the forest - there's lots to discover in the company of these two elves. You must look carefully and memorize the motif in order to find the right tile to place on the the right board. Four beautifully illustrated scenes make up this lotto game that can be adapted for different age groups.
An adventurous journey with the elves! A fun lotto game for 1-4 children, 3 years an up.

boardgame.name: Alphabeto
boardgame.description:
Who can say their ABC festest?
Children learn the alphabet in the twinkling of an eye. There is a clearly recognizable motif for each letter. In addition you can practice german reading.

boardgame.name: Fantastico
boardgame.description: Bords of a feather flock together, and the idea of Domino Fatastico is just a simple: You have to place two identical mofifs next to each other. Played alone or with others, hardly any other game is as versatile and variad as Fantastico. Younger players will love looking at the carefully chosen images and to describe them before starting to play. And for older children, there are amusing variations thyt guarantee exitement.

boardgame.name: The Square Watermelon Game
boardgame.description:
Equipment consists of a 7x7 board and watermelon shaped pieces in Green and Red. There are 24 pieces of each color.

The board starts off empty. Green goes first. For his first move, Green is not allowed to place any piece in the center space.

Players take turns placing a piece on any empty space. They are attempting to form squares using their tokens to mark the 4 corners of the square. Squares can be any size and any orientation. Which sometimes makes them difficult to perceive. It is possible for a single piece to complete the corners of several different squares.

After a player sets a piece, they check to see if any new squares were formed. They make note of how many and keep a running total. A player is given a reasonable time to count up all the new squares, and then the next player may take his turn. If a player spots any new squares after the other players sets a piece, that player loses those points.

After the last piece is set, the scores are tallied. High score wins.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Renegade Scout 2: Bleeding Edge Retro Gaming
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Renegade Scout.

What is Renegade Scout? Other than 206 pages jammed full of gaming goodness?

This is a set of science fiction miniatures rules aimed at not only recapturing the spirit and feel of old school science fiction gaming, but presenting it in an updated and improved form, combining familiar mechanics with the polish and elegance expected in a modern game.

Using this system, you can command everything from tentacle aliens to squads of futuristic troopers, tanks, walkers, dinosaurs and more. Rules include off-map support, supernatural powers and a host of strange terrain features and world conditions to fight among.

If you are looking to revive some of your favorite old miniatures, note that Renegade Scout is profile compatible with the two first editions of the most popular gothic scifi wargame, allowing troops and weapons to be used as is, but with sleeker and more elegant mechanics.

If you want a fully fledged space opera setting to dive into, you can explore the worlds of Unified Space, where a host of alien species battle for supremacy, from the blood-stained cyborg troops of the Converted to the proud K'Erin and mysterious Engineers.

If you want to just open the book and play, we include 8 Battle Scenarios ready to play with your own armies, as well as the Objective Battle letting you fight an unpredictable encounter with randomly generated objectives.
Scenario driven gaming more your speed? An array of tools and mechanics cover everything from radio communications to barricading doors.

The Army Builder allows you to construct a huge range of forces for any of the included troop types, for pick-up games using an army list and a fully fledged points system lets you build your own custom forces.

Want something a bit bigger? Why not start a Persistent Game where your troops gain experience from battle to battle. Perfect for campaigns or league play.

In short, almost whatever it is you are into and whatever scale of miniatures you enjoy, Renegade Scout has something for you.

Note that this is a fully updated 2nd edition of the rules, featuring much expanded content, material from several supplements, brand new options and far more pick-up-and-play possibilities than before.

If you are an experienced player, please enjoy this new edition generously funded by the fan base.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Pippi Langstrumpf: Socken suchen
boardgame.description:
Who is the fastest in searching for socks?
The children are rolling 3 die and try to find the sock with the correct combination of colours. The fastest child gets the sock and the ones with the most socks at the end of the game wins.

boardgame.name: Pippi Langstrumpf: Absolut knifflig!
boardgame.description: This is a tricky game for smart kids! They need to arrange 9 cards in a square so that all figures look correct. At the end, you should see a picture of Pippi Longstocking, Mr. Nilsson and the little uncle.

boardgame.name: Vario Tino
boardgame.description: The dwarf Tino and his frieds love colours. They each like to dress in one colour, and that should be different from everybody else's. Item for Item, they collect their clothes - mostly from the nice clean ones hanging on the washing line. The search for the right colour is made more exiting because it can only be seen when a foil is laid over the item of clothing. Now, from the three basic colours ther are many more mixed colours.

boardgame.name: Pippi Langstrumpf: Südsee-Wirbel
boardgame.description: A cool jump & run game with Pippi and her friends.

boardgame.name: Castelino
boardgame.description:
A magnificent feast is to be held at the great royal palace. All of you, princes and princesses, from all corners of the kingdom, are invited! But hurry, because everyone has to gather the in the palace grounds before the king himself arrives.

The main focus of this game is on the recognition and matching of the basic colours and an early understanding of rules.

boardgame.name: Pizza Fiesta
boardgame.description:
The aim of this game is to top your pizza base with all the correct ingredients first. There is another game variant where you'd need to be the first one to collect four pizza cards as quickly as possible.
Pizza fiesta contains many more variants - all of them fun to play and at the same time requiring full attention and responsiveness!

boardgame.name: The Dogs of War
boardgame.description:
"The goal is to collapse adversary’s system into confusion and disorder causing him to over and under react to activity that appears simultaneously menacing as well as ambiguous, chaotic, or misleading."

John R. Boyd, “Patterns of Conflict”


At 0400 Zulu Time, July 24 1985, Warsaw Pact forces cross the Inner German Border and assault NATO positions in West Germany. The main thrust, formed by 10 Soviet Category I Divisions, is in the BAOR sector and points directly to the Ruhr area.

Taking its roots from SPI’s Central Front and NATO: Division Commander, The Dogs of War is the second module of the C3 series, focused on Command, Control and Communication.

All the elements of modern mechanized warfare are covered: Chemical and Nuclear Weapons, Attack Helicopters, Engineers, Electronic Warfare, Counter-battery Fire, Ribbon Bridges, Army Doctrines, Reconnaissance units, Close Air Support coordination and more.

Several typical wargame mechanics have been reinterpreted, and both sides will fight three equally dangerous foes: the enemy, their own plan and time. Even a simple action can quickly turn into a disaster when facing an opponent using more efficiently the real key to victory: the OODA Loop theorized by John Boyd in the early ‘80s and used today as the basis for several military doctrines.

Military doctrine, tactics and peculiarities for each side are represented, allowing a skilled commander to use his own strength points and exploit the enemy’s weak ones. Some examples are:


West German Auftragstaktik (Mission-Type Orders), giving Bundeswehr a flexibility hardly obtained by other armies.
British Engineers, allowing extensive use of prepared defense positions.
BAOR logistic deficiencies and ammunition shortage.
Soviet Sappers, first-line assault units used to crack the toughest nuts.
Soviet Assault From March doctrine.
Warsaw Pact vulnerable supply network.




Game Highlights


5 km per hex, 3 hours per game turn
Regiment / Battalion sized ground units
Detailed Order of Battle set in 1985
Close Air Support and Attack Helicopters
Command, Control & Communication related problems
Electronic and Intelligence Warfare
Artillery interdiction and Counter-Battery fire
Chemical and Nuclear warfare
Specific events for Warsaw Pact and NATO
Random events to further increase battlefield chaos
Two Campaign Games:
"The River Weser Deep and Wide", Warsaw Pact offensive in BAOR sector.
"One Minute to Midnight", all-out chemical and nuclear warfare after several weeks of tension and build-up

Four Smaller Scenarios:
"Welcome to Braunschweig", West German 2 Panzer Brigade defense of the city against Soviet 35th Motorized Rifle Division.
"They Came Before Dawn", Soviet 76th Guards Airborne assault to key crossings on Weser and Leine rivers.
"Give Me the Night", British 1st Armoured Division fight to slow down Soviet 3rd Shock Army assault.
"Queen's Gambit", British 3rd Armoured Division counter-attack at D+4.





Game Components


98×55 cm matte plasticized map, covering BAOR area of responsibility
1000+ 5/8″ matte plasticized counters
44 Action and Event Cards
30 pages Rules Booklet
30 pages Scenarios & Designer’s Notes Booklet
10 pages Examples of Play Booklet
2x Tables booklets
4x Players' Aid Charts
2x 10-sided dice
10x zipbags

boardgame.name: Vines in Bloom
boardgame.description:
Vines in Bloom is a tile-laying game with the goal of growing and branching your vine to have the most flowers in bloom by the end of the game.

As vines grow, they will split and compete for space on the board. When vines get entangled, your blossoms might get eliminated and removed from the game.

Grow your vine strategically to maximize the number of blossoms you get, balancing how much you want to grow and how many blossoms you want to keep safe, instead.

The game can be played from 1 up to 4 players.

Gameplay:
- Your goal is to grow and keep the most blossoms by the end of the game.
- Two tiles from your hand must be passed to the next player. You can use the rest to grow your vine.
- By branching, you gain blossoms, while also getting more connection points for future tiles.
- As the board fills, competing vines converge and can remove other player's blossoms.
- Single blossom tiles keep a blossom safe from removal, but also prevent that branch from growing further.
- Triple blossoms earn an extra point, give protection, and increase the number of tiles you can place each turn.
- At the end of your turn, draw tiles back up to your hand limit.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Wilderness Survival School
boardgame.description:
A game of survival and exploration, for 1 - 4 players (ages 10 and up), by Steadman Watson

As a student of the Vildhall School of Wilderness Survival, you and your friends learn valuable survival skills. Now it is time to put those skills to the test on a wilderness adventure. Grab your pack, fill your canteen, check your compass and let’s head out on an adventure!

The objective of Wilderness Survival School is to make it back to town with the highest Karma score, which represents how well each player’s adventure went overall.

Each player holds cards representing the courses they have completed, which enable specific feats of outdoor survival. There are four foundation course feats available to all players: Fire Making, River Fording, Route Finding, and Shelter Building. In addition, each player selects two elective feats. Feats are not always successful, and players roll dice to determine how they did.

Before setting out on an adventure, each player fills their Day Pack with various supplies, keeping in mind the equipment requirements for chosen feats.

Each player has their own scorepad to track their vital statistics. Every player starts with the same amount of Health Points, Energy, and Karma. Health Points is the capacity to absorb damage, Energy is the capacity to take actions, and Karma is the sum of a player’s actions, both good and bad.

Each day is broken down into 6 turns, which are tracked using a turn tracker. Turns 1 - 4 are in the daylight, while turns 5 and 6 are at night. Movement and feats are undertaken during the day, while the night is used to recover Energy.

As players move, they will explore nearby terrain (moving meeples) and gradually expand the map. The map is composed of hexagon tiles; new tiles are placed by the players using simple rules and the map is different each time the game is played. Moving through the wilderness is how players will have wildlife encounters, locate additional food and water, and eventually find the way back to town.

The game ends as soon as all players make it back to town. Once everyone is back, the players tally up their Karma (including any of the secret objectives found on the foundation feat cards).

Whoever has the highest Karma score wins!

—description from the desinger

listing.notes:
A thematic game of survival and exploration, for 1 - 4 players (ages 10 and up).
As a student of the Vildhall School of Wilderness Survival, you and your friends learn valuable survival skills. Now it is time to put those skills to the test on a wilderness adventure. Grab your pack, fill your canteen, check your compass and let’s head out on an adventure!
Please see BGG listing for additional information.

boardgame.name: ECK: A solo trick-taking card game
boardgame.description:
ECK (pronounced like “deck” without the ‘d’) is an abstract solo trick-taking game where the you play against the AI opponent ECK by attempting to collect trick cards by winning exactly the number of tricks shown on the available trick cards. The ranks are polygon shapes where increased complexity means increased trick value: line, triangle, square, pentagon, hexagon, octagon. The suits are colors red, orange, yellow, green, blue, and purple. So there are 6 ranks and 6 suits. There are also 6 circle cards, three white and three black, which act as trump cards.

The player draws a hand of 13 cards and plays one trick for each card. The AI opponent ECK is the remaining cards, and in each trick the player plays one card and ECK plays one card based on the rules for following suit.

There are 7 trick cards numbered 2,4,6,8,10,12, and 13/0. The player's goal is, at the end of each round, to have won exactly the number of tricks shown on one of the available trick cards, collecting that card if successful. Collecting 4 trick cards wins the game, though there are ways for ECK to win also.

boardgame.name: Társasház
boardgame.description:
This is a deduction party game for 3-5 persons, offering 30-45 minutes playing time.

A group of novice detectives are deployed to a condominium where every tenant is likely to be a crook. Each detective receives a description of a certain suspect, and their task is to find their target person in one of the apartments. The player who is first to succeed wins the game.

One of the players takes the role of the Game Master, acting for the tenants. The rest of the players compete with each other in the investigation, which must be done by questioning the tenants. However, as they all have something to hide, they may be willing to give some bits of information on their neighbors only, and never about themselves.

All the detectives receive a police file with a suspect’s description, a dozen question cards, a player aid used for deduction, and some cash which might come in useful to make people talk. In their turn, the detectives knock on a door of their choice and ask a few selected questions by playing their question cards. Their ultimate goal is to locate the suspect by deduction, based on the answers they get during the game.

When a player asks a question about the occupant of a certain apartment, the Game Master checks the back of the relevant door card (visible only to him/her), and tells the answer based on the 12 data found there. But as the answer will be heard by all the players, everyone can note it down and use it for their own progress! Door cards are placed on the table randomly. Not knowing which tenants the detectives will be looking for, the Game Master is not in the position to give hints. But his or her spirited answers can make this party game great fun for everyone!


============

Description in Hungarian:

A Társasház 3-5 személy számára ajánlott dedukciós partijáték, mely kb. 30-45 percig tart.

A rendőrfőnök egy csapat kezdő nyomozót ráállít egy társasházra, ahol csupa gyanús alak és körözött bűnöző él. Mindannyian kapnak egy-egy személyleírást, és ennek alapján kell megtalálniuk a maguk emberét a sok egyforma ajtó mögött. Akinek ez elsőként sikerül, az nyeri a játékot.

Az egyik játékos játékmesterként vesz részt, ő személyesíti meg a ház lakóit, a többiek nyomoznak, egymással versengve.
Az utasítás értelmében a nyomozást a lakók kikérdezésével kell lefolytatni. Csakhogy ebben a házban minden lakónak van rejtegetni valója, ezért legfeljebb a szomszédairól hajlandó elárulni pár lényegtelennek vélt információt.

Minden nyomozó kap egy-egy rendőrségi aktát egy személyleírással, egy tucat kérdéskártyával, egy információs segédlettel, valamint némi készpénzzel arra az esetre, ha egyeseket csak vesztegetéssel lehet rábírni az együttműködésre. A nyomozó játékosok feladata, hogy minden körben bekopogtassanak egy lakásba, feltegyenek néhány jól megválasztott kérdést a kérdéskártyáik kijátszásával, majd a kapott válaszokból a játék során kikövetkeztessék, melyik ajtó mögött bujkál az álaluk keresett személy.

A válaszokat a játékmester adja meg: a játék elején véletlenszerűen lehelyezett ajtókártyák túloldalán – csak számára láthatóan – megtalálható mind a 12 lehetséges válasz. A kérdéseket és a válaszokat azonban mindenki hallja, így azokat más játékos is lejegyezheti, felhasználhatja! Mivel a játékmester előtt is titok, ki melyik lakót keresi, segíteni még akaratlanul sem tud. Ellenben ő és a válaszai adják meg a játék igazi hangulatát!

boardgame.name: Souvenirs
boardgame.description:
Souvenirs is a card game in which players collect valuable collections of travel souvenirs.
There is a row of open souvenir cards on the table (one card more than there are players in the game). Each player has a set of hand cards. In each turn, players select a hand card that marks the souvenir they would like to collect. Cards are revealed simultaneously. If a player was the only one who chose a certain souvenir, they can collect it; the unclaimed souvenirs are cleared and can reappear later. When a player has collected a certain set of souvenirs, they can claim a mission card.
At the end of the game (when there aren't enough souvenirs left for a new round, or when all mission cards are claimed.
Scoring is for each souvenir, for claimed mission cards and for certain preferences of each player (each player has a favorite continent, for example). Highes score wins.

boardgame.name: AuZtralia: TaZmania
boardgame.description:
In AuZtralia, humanity came to build a new world after a long war against the Old Ones. They failed. The old terrors were waiting for them and pushed them back to the coast. Now their only hope lies in a nearby small island, TaZmania. Will this be the promised land?

AuZtralia: TaZmania is a dual-map expansion for AuZtralia designed specifically for 1-2 players, or (if playing with the Revenge of the Old Ones expansion) three players. One side has a fixed map that is surveyed for resources and Old Ones, while the other side is randomized through a set of 66 terrain tiles.

This expansion also includes a solo campaign mode that can be played on the new TaZmanian maps or on the original maps.

boardgame.name: Pathfinder Pawns: Extinction Curse
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Deadly foes and memorable monsters from the Extinction Curse Adventure Path are ready to captivate your players and menace your tabletop with the Extinction Curse Pawn Collection, featuring more than 100 creature pawns for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or any tabletop fantasy RPG! Printed on sturdy cardstock, each pawn presents a beautiful full-color image of a monster or NPC from the Extinction Curse campaign, including subterranean horrors, dangerous dinosaurs, evil clowns, and even a few potential friends and allies. The Extinction Curse Pawn Collection, together with the creatures from the Pathfinder Pawns: Bestiary Box, provides pawns for many Extinction Curse encounters. Each cardstock pawn slots into a size-appropriate plastic base from the Pathfinder Pawns Base Assortment, making the pawns easy to mix with traditional metal or plastic miniatures. The Extinction Curse Pawn Collection brings to life the enemies and allies from all six adventures of the Extinction Curse Adventure Path!

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Kingpin
boardgame.description:
Wilson Fisk is a criminal mastermind and the single most feared, dangerous, and powerful crime lord in New York City. From humble beginnings as a poor street thug, Fisk used his genius intellect, physical strength, and sheer ruthlessness to remove all rivals and become the unseen ruler of all organized crime in the city.

As the Kingpin, Fisk is a master manipulator, controlling events to increase his power and the reach of his criminal empire. When an example has to be made, the Kingpin uses his enormous strength and skills in the martial arts to utterly crush his foes in physical combat. Counting the likes of Spider-Man, Daredevil, and the Punisher among his long list of enemies, the Kingpin has no qualms in exploiting his adversary’s principles to usher their destruction.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Marvel: Crisis Protocol

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Bullseye & Daredevil
boardgame.description:
As a boy, Matt Murdock was blinded in an accident involving radioactive chemicals. Though he could no longer see, the chemicals heightened Murdock’s other senses and imbued him with an incredible 360-degree radar sense. With years of martial arts training under the ninja master Stick and fueled by a relentless pursuit of justice, Matt Murdock protects the innocent of Hell’s Kitchen as Daredevil, the Man Without Fear!

A psychopathic assassin, Bullseye is one of the deadliest men in the world. Beyond his superb skills in hand-to-hand combat, Bullseye was born with the innate ability to throw any projectile with lethal force and accuracy. As a costumed criminal, Bullseye has crossed paths with many of the world’s greatest heroes, but he holds a special hatred for his nemesis, Daredevil, stopping at nothing to put him down once and for all.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Marvel: Crisis Protocol

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Punisher & Taskmaster
boardgame.description:
Frank Castle was a former Marine just trying to pick up a normal life with the family he loved. But when that family was murdered, Frank swore to avenge them by punishing those who hurt the innocent. Proficient in close quarters combat, a trained marksman, and an explosives expert, Frank now stalks the mean streets delivering his own brand of personal justice as the Punisher.

When Anthony Masters injected himself with an experimental serum designed to unlock the brain’s procedural memory potential, he gained the ability to instantly replicate the physical movement of anyone he saw. Using these photographic reflexes, Masters took on the name Taskmaster and became a mercenary, selling his skills to the highest bidder. Thanks to his Mnemonic Memory, Taskmaster is able to memorize, utilize, and predict the attacks of any opponent, turning their own physical abilities against them.

boardgame.name: Warhammer Underworlds: Beastgrave – Arena Mortis
boardgame.description:
Warhammer Underworlds meets fast-paced multiplayer combat in Arena Mortis – an expansion that transforms the ultimate competitive miniatures game into a furious free-for-all!

This boxed set lets you transform your Warhammer Underworlds collection into a new kind of game. Picking your favourite hero, you'll embark on arena battles that are fast paced, fun and that'll push your Warhammer Underworlds skills to the limit!

Includes:
- 20 all-new Gambit cards – designed for Arena Mortis but usable in ANY of your games
- 20 all-new Upgrade cards – also usable in ordinary games of Warhammer Underworlds
- A double-sided game board to play on, compatible with all existing Warhammer Underworlds boards
- Tokens and Cards for keeping track of the game
- Updated cards for the Restless Dead gambit and the Sepulchral Warden, reprinted for your convenience incorporating the latest rules updates

-description from the publisher's website
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Warhammer Underworlds: Beastgrave
Warhammer Underworlds: Nightvault
Warhammer Underworlds: Shadespire

listing.notes: New, never opened! Packaging has light storage wear.

boardgame.name: Delta-System
boardgame.description:
[D]ic[E] [L]ess [TA]ble-talk System

From the introduction:

At first, in Japan, "paper and pencil RPG" is called as "Table talk RPG". The term of "Table talk RPG" used by SNE one of Japanese RPG designers group first. So, I call this system as "Diceless Table talk system".

This Delta-System is a new approach to Role Playing Game system, replacing the random roll of dice with the player's decision of what need to be paid attention at the exact moment of combat and other tasks. Deciding combat and tasks become a bidding process between the player and the gamemaster (GM). This method requires a quick mid and fast thinking.

Delta-System is a generic system and only an engine. This is based on the method of representation of PC's abilities and skills. But, Delta-System has no worlds now. So, the GM must provide his or her own world and scenarios to play this system.

boardgame.name: Luck! System
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In this Role Playing Game(RPG), your character has only two parameters. One of those are called as "Luck point", or "Unluck point" (if you want to call it as "Karma point", you call so). And this Lucky point will starts at 0 for all Player characters (PCs). Another parameter is Damage point. Damage point starts at 0 too, for all PCs. All of other settings such as name, sex and other things are determined as you like.

boardgame.name: Σ System
boardgame.description:
[Si]mple & [G]eneric [Ma]stering System

↓


SiGMa System

↓


Σ-System

From the introduction:

This Σ-System (hereinafter referred to as Σ) is an original general-purpose RPG system created by Satoshi Kobayashi in cooperation with the Toyohashi University of Technology SF Study Group. I have continued to work on the game with the primary goal of retaining it as a general-purpose system.

In addition to being versatile, I have the goal of making the system easy for beginners.

boardgame.name: She Sees Red
boardgame.description:
She Sees Red is a mature, hard-boiled interactive thriller. When someone is killed inside a nightclub, an experienced detective vows to put the murderer behind bars. Make choices that affect the narrative and experience several different endings in this blood-red interactive movie.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Full Count
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Full Count: Ladies and Gentlemen

Welcome to tonight's card! And let me tell you, we are very pleased to be back in New York City! Before we start, let us remind you of a few things - first of all.... (more flavour text. This should take up the entire first page (after the cover), with a "screaming crowd" style image underneath it.)

Introduction

Full Count (Role-Playing in the Monday Night world of Professional Wrestling!) is a set of rules and source material for roleplaying in a pro wrestling "world". Full Count requires that you have a copy of the Fudge roleplaying system - see the About Fudge section for information on getting your copy.

Why Pro Wrestling?

Because I like Pro Wrestling?

User summary:

Full Count, sometimes Full Count Fudge, was envisioned as a "rules light sourcebook for role-playing in a pro wrestling 'world'". It was published in HTML format. The game is incomplete, though functional with some additional work.

boardgame.name: GeneSys: General Roleplaying System
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

GeneSys (General Roleplaying System) is a roleplaying system designed for easy use. Easy, that is, for both GameMaster (whom I will call GM from now on) and players.

GeneSys was designed when I was fed up with learning the umptieth exotic rule for doing always the same thing whenever I bought a new roleplaying game (RPG). It was meant to take what was best in my favourite system, to augment what I felt was lacking, and then to be grafted onto any game world I wanted to use.

In addition, GeneSys was meant to be easy to learn so that no tables or memorization were necessary. It should be understood rather than learned by heart. It should be able to deal with all situations arising in RPGs while giving preference to creativity and role playing.

GeneSys enables you to play exactly the character you would like to play. It does not restrict character creation in any way. GMs should, however, take precautions if they want to restrict power gamers who want to play all-powerful characters.

For the GM, the system should be easily adaptable to any existing game world. The keyword here is 'should'. In practice, the rules system of the game world may or may not be easily convertible to a percentile base as it is used in GeneSys. But with some practice and common sense it should be possible to reflect any and all rules using the basic set of GeneSys mechanics.

The major exception to this rule is the magic system. As magic is something entirely different from, say, riding a horse, different games reflect different ideas about magic. This is where most adaptive work comes into play.

First and foremost, have fun with it! GeneSys is intended to help you concentrate on roleplaying instead of mechanics.

boardgame.name: Gnosys Fantasy Roleplaying System
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Okay, here's where we will talk about the basic rules.

The main rolls used in this system are called "challenge rolls" or CR from now on. A CR is %dice + modifier against opponent %dice + modifier, where the higher of the two succeed. i.e.: I attack with my sword(my action is 30%), and my foe blocks with his shield(his action is 10% + 10% for the shield = 20% action), I roll %dice (I roll a 45%) add the modifier(45 + 30 = 75%), compare it to his roll(he rolls 50% + 20%modifier, so 70%), mine is higher so I succeed, and he does not block the blow. This is done for most actions, even non combat action, i.e. moving quietly against opponents hearing, climbing a wall against the hazardousness of the wall.

There are two different %'s used, first is the skill %(S%), this is the actual skill you have in this skill. next is the action %(A%), this is the modifier used when making a CR.

boardgame.name: Hallucinogenia
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Hallucinogenia is a game about adventure, action, horror, black comedy, mystery and the occult.

Set in around the last decade of the 19th century, in a world that is similar to but not quite like ours, Hallucinogenia will lead you to the twilight world of spies, gentlemen adventurers, soldiers of fortune, magicians, alchemists, mad scientists, revolutionaries, Bohemian poets dreaming opium dreams, ghost hunters, brutal thugs and daring airship pilots.

It will lead you into shady opium dens of London, the bohemian establishments of gay Paris, far-off lands, princely manors, lost cities, ancient tombs, strange places hidden between the ripped fabric of reality. You will encounter things weird and wonderful, humourous and horrifying, beautiful and twisted.

The world of Hallucinogenia is a world of secrets, a world where jealous States play the Great Game of espionage, sacrificing morality and ethics on the altar of national rivalry. Here mad scientists build their impossible Infernal Devices, bypassing the limits of mere reality. It is a world where magicians seek enlightment and power through studying the alien energies of the five elemental fields, trying to harness and utilise their power. Here the dead may not always lie down, coming back to haunt the living.

User summary:

Hallucinogenia was published partially in five PDF files (Chapters 1, 3, and 6; a Character Sheet; Calendar 1890-1899). Chapters 2, 4, and 5 apparently were never published.

boardgame.name: ImPound
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In ImPound, you're an intelligent dog. Maybe you're bipedal, maybe you're not. Maybe you have hands, maybe you have paws. Maybe you're a terrorist revolutionary, maybe you're a wage hound. It's up to you--but whoever you end up playing, you're probably dissatisfied with the system.

boardgame.name: Nigh-Invulnerable! The Guide to Simplified Supers
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

INVULNERABLE Tabletop Super Hero Roleplaying Game is kind of crunchy. Sometimes, you just want [to] get stomping on evil quickly! The sourcebook Dauntless speeds up Character creation with its Profession and Tactical Role Packages and random tables, and the Health Pool Optional Rule in Invunerable helps, too. But for even faster play, with fully random heroes, look no further!
boardgame.rpg: Invulnerable Tabletop Super Hero Roleplaying Game
