boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Minimalist spy/kung fu action.

boardgame.name: Space Debris
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Minimalist space opera.

boardgame.name: The Brady Bunch Game
boardgame.description:
Player spins and moves along his path according to the number they spun. When a player comes to an obstacle on his trail, he must pit it up and go to the red space on his trail and throw the obstacle into the trash barrel. Once the trail is clear, the player picks up his numbered tent and according to the spinner on his turn, advances toward his campsite. He must spin the exact number to land on his campsite. The winner is the first player to get his tent to his campsite.

Content: Gameboard, 6 playing pieces, bases, 16 obstacles, 4 plastic tents, spinner, rules sheet.

boardgame.name: Mothership: Booster Pack
boardgame.description:
The content Booster Pack is all about beefing up the card count and adding even more variety to Mothership. The pack includes:

27x Action Cards (6x Holo Cards)
8x Artifacts Cards
8x Artifact Tokens
6x Class Cards
30x Distress Beacons Cards
10x Development Cards
10x Objective Cards
2x Celestial Hazards
2x City Planets + Stands

Also comes with blank cards for custom content:

8x Blank Action cards
8x Blank Class cards
8x Blank Distress beacons
8x Blank Objectives
8x Blank Developments
8x Blank Artifacts and Blank Tokens
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Mothership: Tabletop Combat

boardgame.name: Middle-Earth Strategy Battle Game: Quest of the Ringbearer
boardgame.description:
The last days of the Third Age of Middle-earth may have been dominated by the many great battles fought during the climactic War of the Ring, yet the most seismic event of all was the destruction of the One Ring and the final defeat of the Dark Lord Sauron. Crucial to this lasting victory over the forces of darkness was the epic journey undertaken by the Nine Walkers – the Fellowship of the Ring – for the deeds of its members, both good and ill, were destined to rule the fate of all.

This expansion for the Middle-earth Strategy Battle Game brings the fateful quest of the Fellowship of the Ring to life. As well as background on where the Fellowship’s journey took them and vivid descriptions of the the many trials and tribulations they faced along the way, the book features a wealth of new rules, Scenarios and profiles. There are also rules for a linked, 28-scenario campaign that enables you to refight every key engagement involving the Fellowship and its members – from the smallest skirmish to the largest battle – with your collection of Citadel and Forge World miniatures.

Inside this 128-page hardback supplement, you will find:

Scenarios: 28 Narrative Scenarios, from the very start of Frodo's journey in Farmer Maggot's crop in the Shire, right through to the destruction of the One Ring in the fire of Mount Doom.

The Journey of the Ringbearer: Rules for linking the Narrative Scenarios together into a flowing campaign, with each battle having an impact on others. These include rules to represent the length of the journey, your Heroes being injured (or even dying!), and recovering their strength between encounters with the enemy.

Armies: Detailed army focuses, including the strengths, weaknesses and key models for five Armies: The Fellowship, Rangers of Ithilien, Wanderers in The Wild, The Black Riders and Cirith Ungol. Also includes two new profiles for the Rangers of Ithilien list, and two for the Wanders in the Wild list.

Legendary Legions: Rules for six new and updated Legendary Legions: The Breaking of the Fellowship, Rangers of Ithilien, Lurtz's Scouts, Depths of Moria, The Black Riders, and Cirith Ungol.

Fantasy Fellowship: Guidelines for creating your own Fantasy Fellowship by assembling Heroes from across Middle-earth in a similar way to the actual Fellowship of the Ring, but accounting for numerous 'what ifs' that could have reasonably happened throughout Middle-earth's and The One Ring's history. Includes rules for selecting a Ringbearer, their Companion, and the rest of The Fellowship. Also provides a slightly revised Fantasy Fellowship campaign, consisting of 23 linked Scenarios. (Please note that you will need the War in Rohan and Gondor at War supplements to be able to play all the way through the scenarios featured in the Fantasy Fellowship campaign.)

Weathertop Masterclass: An extended masterclass on how to best build and paint the Weathertop scenery piece, available on ForgeWorld.co.uk, which was a key location on Frodo's journey.

-description from publisher's website
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Middle-Earth Strategy Battle Game: Rules Manual

boardgame.name: Middle-earth Strategy Battle Game: The Best of White Dwarf Magazine
boardgame.description:
Ever since the Strategy Battle Game burst onto the scene way back in 2001, White Dwarf had featured regular content from Middle-earth – from Battle Reports and tactica to stage-by-stage modelling and painting guides, and even bespoke Scenarios. This supplement includes a collection of the very best Middle-earth articles to grace the pages of White Dwarf over the years. Whether you're a newer player looking to catch up on some classic articles or a veteran who’s after all the best content collated into a single publication, it’s got something for everyone!

This 128-page hardback supplement includes the following classic White Dwarf articles:


Orcs Attack! (White Dwarf 263)
Flight to Freedom (White Dwarf 396)
The Battle for Erebor (White Dwarf December 2017)
The Battle of Pelennor Fields (White Dwarf September 2018)
A Clash of Companies (White Dwarf April 2019)
The Search for the Stone (White Dwarfs January and February 2018)
Duel of Zirakzigil (White Dwarf 281)
Fiends and Fireworks (White Dwarf 309)
Fatty Bolger's Great Escape (White Dwarf 311)
The Hunt for Gollum (White Dwarf 302)
Warg Chase in the Wilderness (White Dwarf September 2017)
The Bigger they Are... (White Dwarf 307)
The Brown Wizard (White Dwarf April 2018)
River Assault Rules (White Dwarf 294)
War of the Long Lake (White Dwarf April 2017)
Armies of Middle-earth (White Dwarf November 2018)
Magic of Middle-earth (White Dwarf December 2018)
Modelling Workshop – Mordor Terrain (White Dwarf 344)
Flight of the Nazgûl (White Dwarf 365)
Paint Splatter – Théoden, King of Rohan (White Dwarf September 2018)
Paint Splatter – Gandalf the White and Pippin (White Dwarf December 2018)


—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Middle-Earth Strategy Battle Game: Rules Manual
Middle-earth Strategy Battle Game: The Lord of the Rings – Battle of Pelennor Fields

boardgame.name: Slappy Camper
boardgame.description:
Race to pack up your camper! You must think on your toes to slap the right camping gear, but watch out – slap the wrong card and you may find yourself unpacking! Be the first to fill your camper to win this game of quick reflexes and creative problem-solving.

EASY TO PLAY: Flip the cards to see what camping gear you can pack next, then use your marshmallow slappers to smack the matching card on the table! Be the first to fill your camper with no extra spaces.

boardgame.name: Don't wake up Cthulhu!
Réveille pas Cthulhu!
不要唤醒克苏鲁！
boardgame.description:
Who will make the irretrievable mistake?
The stars are in alignment and great Cthulhu is finally ready to wake! Your cult has been working on it for centuries, but on second thought… is this really such a good idea? Conjure up all the nefarious entities of the Cthulhu mythos and be clever in how you use their effects, so you’re not the one who dooms us all! Honestly, your rivals would make much better appetizers for the Great Old One!

Gameplay :

You start the game with 5 cards.
During your turn, you must draw a card and you can play as many cards as you want.
If you draw a Cthulhu card, you must play it immediately, and if you can’t pass it to another player or get it back into the deck, you lose the game (and Cthulhu destroys the earth, so basically everybody loses, but you die first, so there is that)!
Basically, do everything you can to avoid being the one who summons great Chtulhu!


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Naruto: Ninja Arena
boardgame.description:
The Chûnin exams are in full swing ! This is a great opportunity for Naruto, Sasuke, Sakura and Shikamaru to spar in frenzied bouts and practice mastery of their techniques and special powers. The young Ninjas will use their skills to the best of their ability and try to bring down their rivals by inflicting damage that will add up to wounds, knock outs, or even worse, final elimination. The last Ninja standing wins!

Naruto: Ninja Arena is the first game using the Roll & Clash system. During the game, you throw your dice as quickly as you can and use the results to activate Techniques without stopping the game. Everyone plays at the same time in a frantic battle to be the last Ninja Standing! The game ends when all players are K.O. or eliminated except one.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Animal Voyage: Island Adventure
boardgame.description:
RELEASED - DEFUNCT GAME




The game is no longer playable in any form.




User Summary

Stranded on an island with a bunch of animals you have to try to build up a shelter into an animal paradise!

Game servers have been shut down.

boardgame.name: Cosmic Dragon Breviary
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fueled by a creative passion for designing content of the highest quality to fit at every table, the Cosmic Dragon Breviary is a flavor-packed mini-compendium of 5e options, catalyzed by a simple question from one of my closest friends—the brainiac Dragonborn Wizard player in my game: “Hey, wouldn't it be cool if there were Sun and Moon Dragons?”

“So what are these dragons about? ...Is this only for a space campaign?”

The Cosmic Dragons are a line of neutral dragons—a sort of “missing link,” so to speak, between the righteous Metallic Dragons and the fearsome Chromatic Dragons—that strive to perpetuate the natural balance of the multiverse.

They can be found in a wide array of locales and on nearly every plane, making them a perfect fit for any campaign. Nebula Dragons can thrive anywhere that fine particles abound—from dry, dry deserts to misty mountains cold. And the versatile Planetary Dragons may contest territories otherwise claimed by Green, White, or Red Dragons.

Fellow nerds will especially appreciate the way these dragons incorporate real scientific concepts into D&D mechanics: from Moon Dragons taking on blood moon, blue moon, and supermoon adaptations, to speedy Comet Dragons firing meteors at their foes, and dying Sun Dragons collapsing into black holes that tear open a rift between planes.

boardgame.name: Chess
Chess Free
Chess [AI Factory]
boardgame.description:
Chess incorporates our "Treebeard" Chess engine, an innovative engine using closely guarded state-of-the-art search techniques developed for our competition-level Shogi program, which twice came close to capturing the World Championship crown.

It is eminently suited to use on everything from very small devices right up to giga-byte monster game machines. The engine has the option to run with tiny hand-coded opening books or large hash table books to accommodate differing platform sizes.

Note! This is the chess engine currently used by Microsoft for their MSN chess.

Treebeard also supports the following Chess variants, which adds significant extra value to using this engine. These are Checkless Chess, Rifle Chess, Swap Chess, Bank Rank Chess, Losing Chess and Random Chess.

We have implemented a full 3D version of Chess for the PC, complete with several good-looking piece sets and boards, and over 70 AI opponents of different abilities to choose from.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Ryd bordet
boardgame.description:
All the picture cards are spread on the table and one player reads a topic aloud. Eech player tries to collect all the picture cards that directly or indirectly relate to the subject. The opponents must approve the cards other players have collected, so they need to be able to vouch for their cards. The player who has finally collected the most picture cards has won.

Contains:

150 tasks,
150 picture cards
1 hourglass
rules
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2020 Årets Spel Best Adult Game Winner
2020 Årets Spel Best Family Game Winner
2020 Årets Spil Best Family Game Nominee
2020 Årets Spil Best Family Game Winner

boardgame.name: Megadungeon (#5 - Sep 2020)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The fifth issue of Megadungeon is upon us!

Dungeon adventures, two new dragons, and resources suitable for any campaign! Dual-statted for Basic Dungeons & Dragons and 5e. Come explore the Alchemical Trials, The Lavish Mine of Fur Slime, and the Tuth Tunnels! Meet interesting people and kill them!

Articles on making dungeons exciting, upgrading the home base, with examples for arclight, and the wild Tuth faction in Numenhalla. Anyone who tells you they are a faction is a liar! MEEP! Also contains an extensive advertiser section (hence our new lower price) highlighting some of the best and most interesting projects in the realm of classic gaming!

Heavily illustrated, with a cover by James Shields!

boardgame.name: Gæt
boardgame.description: The participants are tested in their knowledge of toys, children's songs, cartoon characters, superheroes, fairy tale characters and animals. The game consists of a series of cards in 6 different categories, where each card has five clues and an answer. For the individual participant, it is important to guess the correct answer with as few clues as possible. The fewer clues you use, the more fields you can move. For each correct answer, you can either move your own piece forward on the game board, or perhaps choose to move your opponent back. The one who gets around the record the fastest has won.
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2020 Årets Spel Best Family Game Nominee
2020 Årets Spil Best Family Game Nominee

boardgame.name: Princess
Princessa
Princesse
boardgame.description: The princesses want to avoid that, so the game is therefore about getting all the princesses home to the castle so they can prevent the dragon from ruining the party. Princesse is a new exciting adventure game where players must complete the tasks together. Ride the princesses home to the castle without bumping into the fire-breathing dragon. You win or lose together. The game teaches participants about cooperation through simple rules and simple game mechanisms. Can you work together and help the princesses back to the castle before it's too late?
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2020 Årets Spel Best Children's Game Nominee
2020 Årets Spil Best Children's Game Nominee

boardgame.name: Make America Hate Again
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Am Dienstag, den 8. November 2016 trafen die Vereinigten Staaten von Amerika eine schlimme Entscheidung, die das Land auf immer veränderte.

Make America Hate Again ist ein Szenario-Pack für Misspent Youth.

boardgame.name: Book of Hours
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Book of Hours is the eleventh in a series of "Zine Supplements" for #iHunt: The RPG. Or as we'd like to call them, "Zupplements."

This one is a guide to some of the mystical background of the #iHunt setting. Specifically, it deals with three "blood saints," mythological beings that aren't so mythological to the vampires that venerate them. Inside, you'll find cults, practices, beliefs, example worshipers, and tons of story ideas for how to integrate them into your #iHunt stories (and your stories for the upcoming Savage Garden, a game about the vampires in the #iHunt world.)

boardgame.name: Temple of the Moon Priests (Elemental)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bad Moon Rising

A jewel of peculiar power - the Sky Shard - lies buried deep within the lost temple of the Moon Priests. When the King's dying words hint at the temple's location, adventurers from far and wide strike out in search of the stone.

Temple of the Moon Priests is a winner of the One-Page Dungeon Contest, brought to us by co-creators of D&D's Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden. This version contains the original submission, plus ELEMENTAL stats for all the NPCs and a flavourful cast of player characters with their own agendas and motivations.

Drop Temple of the Moon Priests into your campaign or play it as a one-shot. Hand out the provided characters, place them at the entrance of the site and you can enjoy a session of gaming right away, with as little preparation as a board game.

boardgame.name: Rampelys Slammer
Spotlight Slam
boardgame.description: One player acts and others guess. When the others guess what the acting player is portraying, they try to snatch the right card from the table by smashing it with clubs. The fastest smasher gets the card. First player to collect 5 cards wins!
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2020 Årets Spel Best Children's Game Winner
2020 Årets Spil Best Children's Game Nominee
2020 Årets Spil Best Children's Game Winner

boardgame.name: Otterfolk
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Oh, the Otterfolk. These rare creatures live near the water their whole lives, and have gotten used to the almost amphibious lifestyle. Having long ago trekked to the prime material realm from Arkeria, the land of the fey, Otterfolk have adapted to a lifestyle that is harmonious with the habitat they call home. They live together in small communities, working together to provide for each other. Cooperation is key, and as such, they are able to get along with many different sorts of peoples. There are many legends surrounding Otterfolk, such as their benevolent altruism throughout Rizen, helping people out in their greatest times of need, and always standing up against creatures they consider bullies.

boardgame.name: Spell Variants & Exotic Components: Level IX
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A useful handbook containing level 6 spell's variants and new components to empower each spell.

Amulet of the Planes
Bandage of a Mummy Lord
Chain of a Chain Demon
Eye of an Argos
Flask of an Earth Elemental’s essence
Flask of a Feyr’s essence
Flask of a Fire Elemental’s essence
Iron Bands of Bilarro
Lich’s Phylactery
Nine Lives Stealer
One Eternal Flame from the Pit of Flames
Pearl of Power
Powdered tooth of an Astral Dreadnought
Rod of Rulership
Robe of the Archimagi
Scale of a Red Dragon
Scale of a Black Dragon
Scale of a Blue Dragon
Scale of a Green Dragon
Scale of a White Dragon
Scale of a Silver Dragon
Snake of a Medusa’s head
Scale of a Shadow Dragon
Staff of the Magi
Staff of Thunder and Lightning
Wand of Fire

boardgame.name: Dawn Valley
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dawn Valley is a one page scenario set in a dystopian future, in the city of Golden River where law is merely a concept of who’s stronger. This scenario is merely to inspire a story for Role Playing Games (RPG) with a few descriptions of the place and culture as well as some guidance of possible events that may happen.

boardgame.name: The Shi'an (2020 Update)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Shi'an, an ancient alien race driven from their home world after a horrific war. Now, as galactic nomads they hide amongst the shadows of ancient worlds awaiting the opportunity to reclaim their rightful place of interstellar dominion. This supplement introduces a new alien race for use in Goblinoid Games Starships and Spacemen 2E RPG as an alien adversary, player character race, or random encounter creature. Designed for use with the Galactic Setting introduced in Ashdown: Sol & Xoth Sectors For S&S 2E, this product expands that alternate universe with an ancient inhabitant. You can use this product as written or as a source for new ideas for your own game setting. Compatible with Goblinoid Games' Labrynth Lord and Mutant Future or any other OSR Sci-Fi System.

The new 2020 Updated Edition of this product provides expanded artwork and continuity updates for the expanding Ashdown Campaign Universe.

boardgame.name: The Mesmer Legacy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the immediate aftermath of the Revolutionary War, a vengeful British noble, seething from Great Britain’s defeat by backwoods rabble, masters the secrets of mesmerism (psionics) and discovers a way to teach others to do the same. Armed with strange powers of the mind, the students are tasked with going to America and doing only two things: create chaos with their abilities, and recruit others.

Authorities were at a loss to explain the mysterious fires, disappearances, and deaths until no less a luminary than Benjamin Franklin realized what was going on while reviewing documents concerning mesmerism. He hurriedly but quietly assembled a meeting of his fellow physicians and scientists, laid out his discoveries of the links between the strange phenomena, and had no trouble convincing them that action needed to be taken. The response was to recruit and equip special militias to hunt down and neutralize the mesmerists before they succeeded in destabilizing the young country.

The Mesmer Legacy is a paranormal mini-campaign setting for 2D6 RPGs such as Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG). Set in Colonial America in the post-Revolutionary War period, the campaign pits heroic patriots against terrorists with frightening mental powers.

boardgame.name: Lesser Undead (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment presents ghasts, ghouls, skeletons, wights and zombies.

boardgame.name: Lesser Undead (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment presents ghasts, ghouls, skeletons, wights and zombies.

boardgame.name: Lesser Undead (OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment presents ghasts, ghouls, skeletons, wights and zombies.

boardgame.name: Classic Foes (OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment presents barbarians, brigands goblin warriors, hobgoblin warriors, kobold warriors and orc warriors.

boardgame.name: Swip'Sheep
boardgame.description: Each player receives 3 cards. The rest are put to one side. Each player secretly gives one of their cards to the player on their left, and another to the player on their right. When all the players have 3 cards in their hand again, the first player says: "Are there any wolves around this evening?". All the players with a "wolf" card in their hand place it down in front of them. Each "wolf" card equals one attack. Any player with more than one "wolf" card, can attack the same player or different players. Working clockwise, any players who have placed down a "wolf" card now have to attack another player! To attack, the player has to put the "wolf" card in front of another player. If the player being attacked does have a "dog" card, they defend themselves and turn the attack against the wolf, otherwise the wolf attacks, and steals a card from the player's hand at random. The thieves keep the stolen cards in their hand. The used "wolf" and "dog" cards are put to one side. When all of the wolf attacks are over, each player reveals the cards they still have in their hand. The players keep their "sheep" cards to one side. These will ear them points at the end of the game. All the "wolf" and "dog" cards are put back into the deck of remaining cards and a new round begins. When all the rounds have been played, each player counts the number of sheep on their cards.

boardgame.name: The One
boardgame.description:
The personality card game that answers the question everyone wants to know but no one wants to ask, "Which ONE am I in the group?" Get together with some friends and find out what you really think of each other.

The One is the ultimate game to test your friendship group. How well do you really know each other? What stories are hidden deep within that are bursting to come out? Allow this game to help that process.

Are you a plus or a minus?
Are you a bonus or a burden?
Which ONE are you?

Each card has a different personality. Some are positives and some are negatives. Players discuss who best suits 'THE ONE' on each card and must agree on ONE player to receive that card. Every card must be given and there is no limit on the amount of cards a player can receive. When all the cards have been handed out, the player with the highest score is the winner - THE ONE!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: quizzone SKILLS
boardgame.description: In Quizzone Skills, players compete in various skills. Compete on time in categories such as words, maths, letters, songs, puzzles and more. The players take turns reading out questions that the other players answer. All players are involved in all questions, so there is speed across the field once the game starts. How to win: A certain number of rounds are played, depending on how many players are involved. Every time you answer correctly, you get a point chip. After the last round, the number of points is calculated. The player with the most pieces is the winner of the game.
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2020 Arets Spel Best Adult Game Nominee
2020 Årets Spil Best Adult Game Nominee

boardgame.name: Banditti
boardgame.description: Where is the loot hidden? Sausage in the bedroom? Money in the bathroom? Each player receives a robber's house complete with floors, side walls and roof parts for a total of three floors and five loot chips of one color, which he can distribute in his rooms. You roll the dice: For each thrown robber sack you can ask a fellow player a yes / no question about an object; for two or three you can always ask the same player or a different player every time. For a gift as a result you can ask for an item from a player. If you have asked or requested correctly, you receive the chip and place it on your robber's bag. Whoever has collected any five items wins.
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2020 Spiel der Spiele Hit für Kinder Recommended

boardgame.name: Got Grits?
boardgame.description:
You and your pardner find yourselves having a little disagreement. Before you know it, you’re out under the high noon sun on dusty mainstreet, near 20 paces apart, half the town out watching and a mighty silence in the air.

“Alright,” you say, and spit in the dust, “let’s figure this’n out.”

Only natural you’re both real twitchy about now. You’re putting moves on each other, fake draws, designed to rile each other up like a scorpion in a bedroll.

Draw your hands simultaneously, with digits in some arrangement as to signify a 1, 2, 3, 4 or 5.

The player whose number is 1-2 higher will win that round and score a point.

1 beats 4,5
2 beats 5,1
3 beats 1,2
4 beats 2,3
5 beats 3,4

These points are your nerve, or grit. The player with the best nerve will make the best shot, naturally.

The time o’ reckoning comes along when both players throw matching digits.

So do the math, the player with the most grits makes a clean shot.

You decide, do you put a warning into their shoulder or hamstring n’ set their noodle straight, or whistle it real close past their ear like a mosquito or, hell, clean through the top of their hat -that’ll surely send them hightailing out over the arroyo.

Either way it seems that settled things and you figure you’ll both be close as ever, until the next time anyhow.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Oldies But Goodies - Games II
boardgame.description:
Five exciting games to challenge your mind.


3-D TIC TAC TOE: challenge the computer to a game of Tic Tac Toe on a tridimensional board.
HAMMURABI: test your governing ability by becoming the leader of a nation and making decisions which determine whether your country is destroyed or becomes prosperous.
HIDDEN PAIRS: train your memory by matching shapes, monsters or slates
PEGJUMP: exercise your logical powers to remove all but one peg from the gameboard
WORD SAFARI: hunt for the hidden words in the midst of random letters.


(from the front of the box)

boardgame.name: HeadCrushers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sometimes you just need to crush a head to show you mean business. Kick down that door, kick butt, don’t bother taking names, that’s what I’m talking about. When you find out you are in over your head, distract, dodge, defend, and then get the hell out. Fast swords, fast brains, and fast mouths – that’s what you need.

boardgame.name: Crisis in Time
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Instead of the senior year you expect, you are forced to move south and make new friends in a new town. You will need familiar answers to new problems. This interactive book places you as reader and hero so choose wisely. Continues the story from Goblin's Gift and Monsters & Mazes. Contains the Incomplete Quest Lost Book of Parn.

boardgame.name: Warhorn
boardgame.description:
Heed the mighty WARHORN and charge into battle! Warhorn is a fast-paced timed deck-building battle game where horned creatures from the same clan grant cumulative power values of creatures or that creatures clan members that charge into battle. Warhorn has a companion mobile application where players access the WARHORN which is a digital timer that has large buttons where time can be added and subtracted when prompted by certain clan abilities.

When the war horn sounds players unleash their army (play their deck in its current state) trying to deploy their entire army of creatures as efficiently as possible by matching clans in a bid then match or exceed clash. Players whose clan cards are “defeated” go back into the Discharge pile which is later shuffled to create the communal Draft pile.

During the Draft Players will use their time as they see fit to build up their current army for crushing victories, sabotage, and Interfere with their opponents draft or diversify their forces for varied strategic outcomes.

Players may choose to stall during their turn and run down the clock in order to gain strategic advantages forcing other players to play clan abilities to force a turn pass, add or subtract time to or from the Warhorn, or ultimately cause the WARHORN to sound.

Players can choose to hold onto creature cards to create an active hand while the WARHORN is ticking down and Interfere with their opponents all while attempting to adapt to the clans drawn during their turn in order to build a powerful army deck from the communal drafting pile.

Clan cards will have different amounts of troops on them complimenting their clan abilities. The first player to deploy all their creature cards into the fight wins the battle. The first player to win 3 battles wins the war.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Dragon & Flagon: The Brew that is True
boardgame.description:
Dragon and Flagon is a chaotic, fantasy tavern brawl where adventurers of all kinds battle their way to glory in the bar fight to end all bar fights. Each character has their own set of abilities that they can program into their action queue to help them come out of the battle with a glowing reputation. The Brew That is True expansion includes three new additions to the game—nine new characters with unique capabilities, magical potions with a variety of wild and unpredictable effects, and bookshelves that can be sent toppling and change the layout of the bar entirely! All the components of this expansion can be mixed and matched as desired with everything from the original Dragon and Flagon!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: MonstroCity: Rampage Expansion
boardgame.description:
The MonstroCity Rampage Expansion introduce 6 new exciting Monsters, new reinforcement cards and a new challenging way of playing the game, the Scenarios.

The expansion has 4 Different Scenarios:
-Retrieve Monster DNA
-Mystery Formula
-Rescue Maddie Newton
-Dr Spotnik Demise.

Each scenario has different goal, different setup, extra rules that affect gameplay and new victory conditions.

Each game session takes 20 to 30 minutes, depending on the number of players.

-description from publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: MonstroCity

boardgame.name: Dicetroy the Castle
boardgame.description:
Greetings, noble Castellan Ruler to Dicetroy the Castle. As a Castellan, you have many obligations to your family’s name - build castles, protect them, earn treasure, and deliver prosperity to your people. You do this by wisely utilizing the resources your subjects provide as well as waging war on your rivals and attacking their castle and accumulating the most treasure to be the mightiest Castlan Ruler of them all!

Dicetroy the Castle is a dice rolling, matching, stacking, and smashing resource management and dexterity battle game for 2 players.

BASICS OF PLAY

Each player selects 1 Castelan Ruler player screen/backsplash and 20 dice of one color. To prepare for the CULTIVATE phase of each round players will set their screen in front of their battle zone.

CULTIVATE
Flip the 90-second timer (you may choose to play “Peasant mode” and exclude the timer and have the Cultivate Phase be untimed).

From behind their Castellan screen, each player rolls all 20 of their six-sided dice at the same time then sorts, allocates, and places dice from dice that have at least one or more matching values. Unmatched dice and dice that you had no use for or dice that did not get placed before time runs out are returned to your dice pool or "Banished". these are failed farmers and craftsmen who didn't deliver on their promised goods.

PROSPER
Unveil your kingdom! Lift your Castellan screen and place it behind your castle.

DECREE!
Certain Castellan abilities trigger and resolve. State these abilities to your Rival.

PROFIT!
Claim your treasure! Calculate how much treasure you earned and increase your Treasure die accordingly.

WAGE WAR!
Determine which player will attack first by comparing the combined outcome of your Knight dice then alternate attacking each other until a player runs out of boulders or a player is raided making sure to clear all castle rubble in between attacks. After attacking has ended Fortify by either repositioning or clearing dice inside the Castle Zone, adding them back to your dice pool.

When Fortifying all layers must be completed before continuing to build on a castle. All Dice but those remaining in the Castle zone and the Treasure die are returned to that player’s dice pool.

For each completed layer of your Castle still standing after the war has ended, earn 1 Treasure. The first player to end a round with 20 Treasure is the lord of the land and the winner of the game!

THAT IS THE END OF THE AGE! (one round)

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: KICÉKI
boardgame.description:
KICÉKI is an adult card game.
Say out loud what you think and find out what your friends think of you.

Rules of the game:

QUESTION: The first player chooses a question from one of his 5 "question" cards.

VOTING: Each player uses a voting card to designate the player who they think best corresponds to the question asked. Voting is anonymous.

GUESS: The player who asked the question says, “in your opinion, KI CÉ KI”? ". The player who thinks they have received the most votes points to the assembly by raising their hand.

REVEAL: The player who read the question collects all the voting cards and reveals them to all players.

Then give away the anecdotes that justified your choice!

KICÉKI est un jeu de cartes adulte pour apéro et soirées

Règles du jeu:
INTERROGE: Le premier joueur choisit une question parmi l’une de ses 5 cartes « question ».
VOTE: Chaque joueur utilise une carte de vote pour désigner le joueur qui correspond selon lui le mieux à la question posée. Le vote est anonyme.
DEVINE: Le joueur qui a posé la question dit : « à votre avis, KI CÉ KI » ? ». Le joueur qui pense avoir reçu le plus de votes se désigne auprès de l’assemblée en levant la main.
RÉVÈLE: Le joueur qui a lu la question collecte toutes les cartes de vote et les révèle à l’ensemble des joueurs.
BALANCE: Les joueurs partagent à l’assemblée les anecdotes marrantes qui ont justifié leur vote.

C’est le moment de sortir les gros dossiers… Exemples de cartes Question:
KICÉKI a le pire historique de navigation sur Internet ? KICÉKI n'ose pas renvoyer une bouteille de vin bouchonnée ?
KICÉKI a toujours les pires plans foireux ?
KICÉKI renifle ses vêtements pour savoir s'ils sont propres ?
KICÉKI répond 'oui' sans avoir écouté la question ?

boardgame.name: Color Shapes Match
boardgame.description:
Round of the player


Insert a card from your hand in a place a place up, down, right, left or diagonals from another card on the table.
Do the same with the second card in your hand.
If you want, take a card from the table in your hand and place it in the same way.
Get a card from the table that has in its center the shape and color of a shape that has been completed on the table. You can do the same thing as many times as you want if the condition exists.
Place the cards you won in front of you and draw 2 new cards from the deck. That's where your round ends and then the player on the left plays.

boardgame.name: Wolf's Head
boardgame.description:
The night air is cold, and the street burns against my skin. I see myself in one of the windows, grey hair, blue eyes. I remember my life before her treachery, and I find I cannot forgive. I wonder if she still thinks of me, or only her new love. Wolves mate for life.

"Wolf's Head" is a scenario for 1-6 characters. An investigation ranging from the rich suburbs to waste ground, parks and building sites, a missing husband, a grieving wife and a possible murder, provide a challenge for characters regardless of their experience.

boardgame.name: Reluctant
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

How will you handle the first day of high school? This interactive book helps you find out. Ian Dever begins high school, faces challenges from the start, but your choices help her try to fit in. Bullies, isolation, and social stigma stand between Ian and the end of the first day of school. Can you help her find a way through? At the end, compare yourself to the Social Scale to measure success.

Ideal for pre-high school readers and nostalgia trip for Gamebook fans.

2d6 dice, pencil, and paper are required to make your way through the book.

It is an all-ages book that is fun for older readers too.

boardgame.name: Premier Arrivé: 14-18 La Der des Ders
boardgame.description:
Retrace the history of the Great War with this "Der des Ders" (The war to end all wars) battle game.
This battle game on a board where the first to arrive at the end of the game will be the winner.
But watch out for the mud in the trenches!

This strategy and adventure game develops children's imagination and thinking.

Discover the history of WWI with 1000 bornes-type system.

boardgame.name: Nuclear Knights
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a game about knights, about lords, about treasure large and powerful, about robots, about psychics, about beasts that tear flesh and eat brains, and it's about postmasters and it's about iconoclasts, but mostly it's about the friends we made along the way (or at least the ones that will prove useful later).

In the postnuclear apocolypse, thousands of years after the last of the memories of the old world faded, you play as an adventurer. Though the landscape is scrubbed of its legacy, the people are not. Ostensibly, Nuclear Knights is medieval fantasy, but what is magic except laws and nature that you do not comprehend? The artifacts of the old world, laser guns and flaming swords, space helmets and all sorts of insane shit that mortals can only dream of, are what you seek. They lie deep in ruins of the old world underground, or perhaps floating in the sky or just beyond yonder mountain. You and your party, adventurers assembled to venture out for your feudal lords, will attain great power for great peril, and return heroes or villains. More likely something in between the two.

This is the complete Player's Guide and Keeper's Manual. Everything you need to run and play.

boardgame.name: Lasers & Six-Siders
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Lasers & Six-Siders is an ultra rules-lite roleplaying game of exciting space adventure inspired by the earliest of tabletop RPGs (0E, BX, and T&T). Unlike typical OSR (Old School Renaissance) games, it relies on a single six-sided die (1d6) and single, expanding vehicle or monster stat (plus any special abilities) to make gameplay quick and easy. It is great for both new roleplayers and old-schoolers alike who are looking to get more gaming done in less time. Includes Player's and Gamemaster's sections, and is fully compatible with Swords & Six-Siders.

Explore space, tangle with space pirates and other threats, and find new discoveries that you can sell or use to build your power.

boardgame.name: Scholars and Criminals
boardgame.description:
From The Back Cover:

Scholars, those of various backgrounds who study magic without practicing it. Knowledgeable, if not wise, they can be the most unlikely people and the most dangerous if their curiosity ever goes too far.

Criminals. Petty thieves and thugs who try to rise above their station by taking from others. Despite their varying degrees of success they all have one thing in common. They will do anything to get ahead.

This pack contains 10 NPCs, 5 Scholars, 5 Criminals for use with the Principia Malefex game. As well as supporting characters, character sheets and background, the pack also contains support material, including new skills and new tomes.

boardgame.name: Planet Apocalypse: Pack of the Crypt
boardgame.description:
This expansion to Planet Apocalypse contains:

2 Lords (Belphegor and Herne the Hunter)
2 Heroes (Bruno Dawn and Carolyn Totenkopf)
3 Fourth Circle Demons (Cobold, Scurrilet, Fachan)

Maps:
2 Maps (Rome Catacombs and Paris Catacombs)

Cards:
3 Legion Cards (Cibaciba, Caleuche, Tuonela)
2 Region Cards (Poland and Italy)
3 Trooper Cards Types (Carabinieri, Swiss Guard, Territorials)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Planet Apocalypse

boardgame.name: Maximum Apocalypse the Roleplaying Game Gamemaster Guide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Maximum Apocalypse RPG immerses you in a world suffering from multiple extinction level events. The Gamemaster Guide gives you the tools to craft your own apocalyptic adventures. This guide examines how to use the Maximum Apocalypse RPG rules to create environments and formulate your own scenarios. Several premade scenarios are provided in this guide as well so you can start enjoying the game immediately. It is the essential book for Game Masters and when combined with the Monster Manual, makes the perfect set of tools to run any apocalyptic adventure.

boardgame.name: Maximum Apocalypse the Roleplaying Game Game Monster Manual
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Monster Manual contains seventy-two different monsters designed to be used with the Maximum Apocalypse: The Roleplaying Game rules. It contains brief introductions to these monsters, their motivations, and briefly, how to create them. Use this book to populate your Maximum Apocalypse Wasteland with enemies.

Maximum Apocalypse RPG immerses you in a world suffering from multiple extinction level events. Each of the creatures enrich the story by creating different obstacles for players to experience and new dangers to avoid as they attempt to survivor and complete session objectives. Killing these monsters is one way to gain experience and advance your character. But more than that, some of these monsters can be used to create a campaign nemesis, driving the players to their final objective.

boardgame.name: Charta Monstrorum
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In year of the lord 1716, a group of explorers from the Royal Society discovered the remains of the late Dutch surveyor and geographer Clement Birkenbosch. Stories swirled around the recovery of his body, some tall, others terrifying, but as with everything Birkenbosch was involved in during his life the truth is shrouded in mystery. It is said that in his satchel they unearthed various journals and half-written notes as well as more thorough and systematic examinations of the monsters of our world. Included in this remarkable find were Birkenbosch’s own sketches of more than 20 vile and mysterious beasts he had encountered on his travels, including vampires, werewolves, witches and, most incredibly of all, one of the legendary creatures of the deep, the fabled kraken. At first the Royal Society disregarded this find as yet more elaborate fakery perpetrated by members of the Enlightenment Movement to mock the society and undermine its reputation, but as they read further it became impossible to deny that that Birkenbosch had gathered this information first hand from the corners of Europe as well as expeditions into the most dangerous territories of the Middle East and the Subcontinent. It was a truly incredible find. Arguments followed, of course. Some unbelievers claimed Birkenbosch was no more than a storyteller, recounting the tall stories told to him, but the true believers insisted that his profession as surveyor was nothing more than a cover for his true purpose, that Clement Birkenbosch was a servant of a secret society deeply involved in the occult....

Dig deeper into the mysterious and occult world of LexOccultum. Move beyond the veil of darkness and enter the domain of horrid creatures and callous monsters. This is the complete monster manual for the LexOccultum RPG game, this is Charta Monstrorum!
✦ The Journal of Clement Birkenbosh
✦ Speculations and Field Reports For Over 20 Monsters
✦ Monster Stats and Variations
✦ Adventure Hooks

boardgame.name: Maximum Apocalypse the Roleplaying Game Game Core Rulebook
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Maximum Apocalypse: The Roleplaying Game is based on the acclaimed board game series of the same name. In Maximum Apocalpse: RPG, players take on the roles of survivors of one of many apocalypses, adventuring across the ravaged wasteland attempting to survive the many dangers that lurk around every corner. In order to survive, you will need to scavenge and craft new items while also scrounging for food and fighting off everything from zombies to an alien invasion.

The Core Rulebook is the essential reference for every Maximum Apocalypse roleplayer. It contains rules for character creation, skills, exploration, scavenging, combat, crafting, equipment, vehicles and much more. Use this book to create survivors of the apocalypse based on their occupations before the world fell.

Maximum Apocalypse RPG immerses you in a world suffering from multiple extinction level events. Explore the ravaged ruins of cities and wander the wasteland. Battle everything from invading aliens to roaming zombies to sentient machines while searching for food and components to keep you alive. Gain experience and proficiencies in more skills as you work together with other survivors.

Can you survive the Maxium Apocalypse?

boardgame.name: Planet Apocalypse: Nightmare Pack
boardgame.description:
This expansion to Planet Apocalypse contains:

2 Lords (Tuchulcha and Mezu)
2 Heroes (Scott Delrich and Eva Noel)
3 Fourth Circle Demons (Imp Swarm, Wraith Swarm, Killakee Swarm)

Maps:
2 Maps (The Wave and The Last Redoubt)

Cards:
3 Legion Cards (Youdu, Xibalba, Drakulu)
2 Region Cards (Republic of China and People's Republic of China)
2 Trooper Cards Types (Reservist, Air Strike)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Planet Apocalypse

boardgame.name: The Thieves of the Transmuter's Mine
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

1 page adventures is a serie of adventures to you adapt to any RPG system. A perfect plot to start a new campaing or to put in between of your adventures in the most different worlds!


Aventuras de 1 Página é uma séria para adaptar para em qualquer sistema. Um plot perfeito para começar a jogar ou colocar entre suas aventuras, nos mais diversos cenários e ambientações!
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Os Saqueadores da Mina do Transmutador PDF
The Thieves of the Transmuter's Mine PDF

boardgame.name: The Little Death
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A terrible threat casts a shadow across a range of low, green mountains, over a place somehow spared from the biological, environmental, and radioactive catastrophe that transformed the world of before into the Wasteland. Bold scavengers, in service to diabolical masters, scour the scrap heaps of the past in search of valuable technology, while mutants gather in their enclave bracing themselves for war, and the innocents find themselves caught, as usual, in the middle of a coming catastrophe.

In short, everything here is about to become seriously f@#$ed.

The mercs stumble into the plot of the “The Little Death” and have a decent shot at ruining the bad guy’s plans. The mercs also stand a damned good chance of buying the farm in a variety of ways, like being shot, mutilated, eaten by a teleporting freak, subjected to unwanted attention from some mongolongos, or just incinerated in an atomic blast along most of the surrounding Wasteland.

This mission is designed for master characters, if you didn’t catch that already. But, hey, run it for whatever level PC you like for grins, so long as you run it with PunkApocalyptic: The RPG.

boardgame.name: Oath of Conscription
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“It is no blessing I confer upon you, but rather a plea,” the priest said, beginning to apply ceremonial markings to Evelyn's arm. The brown dyes smelled of tea, but the scent drifted away as her focus tightened on the priest's words.

“I plea that you deliver light to a world where often it bleeds out,” He began just below her shoulder.

“I plea that those whom you offer help will see this light in both you and themselves,” The design began to coil around her arm.

“And I plea that the sacrifices you'll make in the name of good will not diminish your own light.” The priest somberly concluded. He lifted the brush from Evelyn's arm, revealing the ornate chain which now marked her skin. She closed her eyes, and instead of the temple she'd always known, she stood atop a precipice, seeing above her rusty skies and legions of the damned below.

Paladins swearing the Oath of Conscription wild the powers of a bound(and often unwilling) fiendish host in the name of the greater good. While wielding these powers, paladins may take on more demonic traits, and find themselves in the path of temptation by the forces of evil. Whether your character rises above or succumbs to this temptation will be a true test of character.

boardgame.name: Fool's Paradise
boardgame.description:
From The Back Cover:

Fool's Paradise is a scenario supplement for use with Principia Malefex, including new scenarios and NPCs for the modern horror roleplay game. Based loosely in the suburbs, it focuses on what goes on behind closed doors, and the culture of silence and non-interference that lets it continue. With the typical low-key approach of Malefex, there is little focus on the supernatural. After all, it isn't as if there weren't enough problems in the world, that we'd need to involve others...

boardgame.name: The Undercroft (Issue 12 - Aug 2020)
boardgame.description:
(user summary)

Continuing OSR-ish weirdness from Melsonian Arts Council, dwarven trinkets, a port town/village for your campaign, and other goodies.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: The Legacy of Vazimak the Thanaturge
The Mountain That is a Man and Also God

boardgame.name: Vault of Dreams
boardgame.description:
From The Publisher:

Often Denis Gerfaud’s scenarios have a wry and skewed take on the classic fantasy roleplaying genre. Rather than postulate prodigious protagonists performing outrageous acts of heroism, they often involve Journeyers stumbling upon a small wrong in the Dreaming needing to be set right. Always, though, the solution is more about correctly interpreting the poetic analogies of the scenario, rather than, er, slaying a dragon so to speak. These scenarios, some by Gerfaud, capture the mood of this game that French players have been enjoying for over two decades. Like the game’s author, they are deliberately skewed, taking as their props everyday situations and objects absurdly or surreally distorted. Vault of Dreams includes: Unicorn Dream, Chrysobelle, Nose of Hypnos, Vale of Phosneratu, Tempest in a Teacup, Sacrificial Oracle, Dread Ringers, Navigator, Dressmaker of Gothga, and Dark of the Well. Appendices provide background on the city of Gothga, and a new creature, the bouncer.

boardgame.name: Yes or kNOw
boardgame.description: The game is a quiz Show and the quizmaster is a Smartphone and all the players compete in a quizbattle.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2014 German Developer Award Best Family Game of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: Squirrel & Bär
boardgame.description: Educational
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2014 German Developer Award Best Family Game of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: Panzer Tactics HD
boardgame.description: In 1939, German and Russian troops attack Poland and plunge Europe into the World War II. Panzer Tactics HD picks up the story here, giving you the chance to experience intense battles in three extensive campaigns with more than 150 units and countless tactical options, offering hours of gaming fun. Relive the offensive of the German troops, the Soviet counter-attack and the liberation of Europe by the Allied Forces across three campaigns. Prove yourself against opponents in more than 30 missions with additional scenarios. Varying terrain, weather and the morale of your troops turn each battle into a challenge, ensuring that no two matches are alike. The enemy will mercilessly exploit any tactical misstep in order to defeat you!
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2014 German Developer Award Best Mobile/Handheld Game of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: Drakensang Online - Rise of Balor
boardgame.description: Deep in the forgotten jungles of Lor’Tac, corruption is spreading. As flora withers and dies, so too does fauna slither and cry. The expeditions sent by Queen Agrasha are not returning, and even worse, the Dark Dwarves are on the move, on a mission to destroy the World’s Heart! It’s time for your biggest challenge yet. Can you brave the perils of the new world and save Dracania?
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2015 German Developer Award Best Browser Game of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: Renu and the Sari Revolution
boardgame.description: Strategy
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2015 German Developer Award Best Narrative of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: Galaxy on Fire - Manticore Rising
boardgame.description: Galaxy on Fire – Manticore RISING is a high-energy space action game specifically designed for the Apple TV.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2015 German Developer Award Most Innovative Game of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: Late For Work
boardgame.description: In Late For Work, one player is a giant gorilla doing gorilla things.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2017 German Developer Award Best VR/AR Game of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: Angry Birds Evolution
boardgame.description: Enter Bird Island in Angry Birds Evolution – a visually stunning RPG with hundreds of new Angry Birds to collect.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2017 German Developer Award Best Mobile/Handheld Game of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: Blautopf VR - Geheimnis der Lau
boardgame.description: The Blautopf cave system is one of the most spectacular natural phenomena of Southern Germany. It is only accessible to scientists. With BlautopfVR - The Secrets of Lau you can now explore these hidden places in a Mystery Adventure Game for HTC Vive.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2019 German Developer Award Most Innovative Game of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: Castleshire
boardgame.description:
Enter a mystical kingdom ruled by an eccentric Majesty besotted with the idea of building the perfect castle. Deft guilds and shady allies thrive in a realm that the world will remember as Castleshire: the land of the thousand castles. You are a rising master-builder and dream of leaving a lasting legacy. You decide to compete in building the chambers of their Majesty’s perfect castle. You are driven by one goal: To become the most famous master-builder of all time.

Everyone is always active. This game has literally no downtime for players. In your turn, you set out to build the castle and increase your fame. You either do this certified using your limited resources or chaotically in an unplanned matter. When not on your turn, you endeavor to bring your adversaries down when they attempt the latter. Use the unique skills of your guild that have been mastered over generations. At any time, everyone is able to force a turn of events to a certain degree with the help of allies who are sprawling in the vicinity of the epic construction site.

A good memory and reading opponents are as helpful as a good poker face. In this socially interactive bluffing game, you will win if you if you are clever and the wittiest of all - constantly adapted to counter other players' evolving strategies.

Solo variant: Castleshire's AI is able to bluff and memorize, and also adjusts to how well you catch the AI's bluffs. Additionally, it captures your bluffing behavior and responds to it. Once you start winning against the AI, you can increase the difficulty level, so you will have to think further ahead and anticipate the AI's next moves more accurately.

—description from the publisher
